translated: Together with the space element, they are the support of semen and menstrual blood. They are eaten for the sake of perfecting body, speech, and mind.

original: zla ba ste khu ba ni dbang phyug go //
analyzed: zla ba ste khu ba ni dbang phyug go //
translated: The moon, that is, semen, is ≈öiva.

original: nyi ma ste rdul ni rtag tu bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: nyi ma ste rdul ni rtag tu bzhi pa'o //
translated: The sun, that is, menstrual blood, is always the fourth.

original: rkang ni drag po'o //
analyzed: rkang ni drag po'o //
translated: The thigh is Rudra.

original: gci ba ni khyab 'jug go //
analyzed: gci ba ni khyab 'jug go //
translated: Feces is Vi·π£·πáu.

original: bshang ba ni tshangs pa'o //
analyzed: bshang ba ni tshangs pa'o //
translated: Urine is BrahmƒÅ.

original: zla ba nyi ma la sogs lha rnams mtshan mo'i chal ste skyed @267b pa'i dus su zos so //
analyzed: zla ba nyi ma la sogs lha rnams mtshan mo'i chal ste skyed @267b pa'i dus su zos so //
translated: The gods moon, sun, and so on are eaten at night, that is, at the time of generation.

original: slar yang ste yang mtha' yas lus la dngos po sna tshogs kyis bzung bar gyur pa ni rnam par 'phrul pa ste de dag rnams gtong bar byed de nges par nyin mo'i dus su zhes pa sdud pa'i dus su gtong zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: slar yang ste yang mtha' yas lus la dngos po sna tshogs kyis bzung bar gyur pa ni rnam par 'phrul pa ste de dag rnams gtong bar byed de nges par nyin mo'i dus su zhes pa sdud pa'i dus su gtong zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Again, that is, once again, having taken on an infinite number of bodies, he gives up those emanations, those various things, for sure during the day, that is, at the time of their dissolution.

original: skyed pa'i rgyur ni ste slar yang gzhan skyed pa'i rgyu ru gtong bar byed do //
analyzed: skyed pa'i rgyur ni ste slar yang gzhan skyed pa'i rgyu ru gtong bar byed do //
translated: He gives up the cause of generation, that is, he gives up the cause of generating others again.

original: rim pas te lte ba dang snying kha dang mgrin pa dang dpral ba dang gtsug tor gyi gnas rnams su sa la sogs pa'i khams yongs su gtong ba'i rim pas so //
analyzed: rim pas te lte ba dang snying kha dang mgrin pa dang dpral ba dang gtsug tor gyi gnas rnams su sa la sogs pa'i khams yongs su gtong ba'i rim pas so //
translated: In stages, that is, in the stages of giving up the elements of earth and so forth in the places of the navel, heart, throat, forehead, and crown.

original: kun rdzob kyi byed pa po'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi byed pa po'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the definition of the relative agent.

original: da ni sgra la sogs pa zhes pa la sogs pas 'jig rten kun rdzob kyi las dang byed pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni sgra la sogs pa zhes pa la sogs pas 'jig rten kun rdzob kyi las dang byed pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, beginning with ‚Äúsound and so forth,‚Äù he speaks of the relative world‚Äôs actions, agents, and so forth.

original: 'dir lus grub par gyur pa na sgra dang reg bya dang gzugs dang ro dang dri dang chos kyi dbyings te drug po rnams ni las su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir lus grub par gyur pa na sgra dang reg bya dang gzugs dang ro dang dri dang chos kyi dbyings te drug po rnams ni las su 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, when the body is formed, the six elements of sound, touch, form, taste, smell, and the realm of phenomena become the object.

original: dbang po drug po dag kyang ste rna ba dang lus dang mig dang lce dang sna dang yid  de drug po ni byed pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po drug po dag kyang ste rna ba dang lus dang mig dang lce dang sna dang yid  de drug po ni byed pa'o //
translated: The six sense faculties, the ear, body, eye, tongue, nose, and mind, become the agent.

original: khyim bcu gnyis kyi dbye bas lo dang zla ba dang zla ba'i tsha'i dbye bas phyogs nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang nyin dang mtshan mo ste nyin mtshan dang tshes bco lnga dang zla ba dang nyi ma dag kyang ste 'di dag mtha' dag ni byed pa'o //
analyzed: khyim bcu gnyis kyi dbye bas lo dang zla ba dang zla ba'i tsha'i dbye bas phyogs nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang nyin dang mtshan mo ste nyin mtshan dang tshes bco lnga dang zla ba dang nyi ma dag kyang ste 'di dag mtha' dag ni byed pa'o //
translated: The twelve houses, the divisions of year and month, the twenty-four divisions of the lunar month, day and night, the fifteen lunar days, and the moon and sun, all of these become the object.

original: byed pa po ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid khu ba 'pho ba'i skad cig lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba ste 'jig rten kun rdzob kyis so //
analyzed: byed pa po ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid khu ba 'pho ba'i skad cig lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba ste 'jig rten kun rdzob kyis so //
translated: The agent is the characteristic of the all-base consciousness, the joy that arises simultaneously with the moment of semen emission, according to worldly convention.

original: 'pho ba'i skad cig la sogs pa byed pa po dang byed pa dang las 'di dag sdud pa'i byed pa po gzhan du 'dir 'gyur te gang gi phyir skyed pa'i byed pa po ni byed pa po ma yin no //üîΩde'i phyir mkha' khyab mkha' yi rdo rje can te yul dang rnam bral yon tan med la rang bzhin med pa'o zhes pa lhan cig skyes pa'i sku ste cha med kun 'gro khyab pa po zhes pa'o de'i phyir skyed pa dang sdud pa'i byed pa po dang mya
analyzed: 'pho ba'i skad cig la sogs pa byed pa po dang byed pa dang las 'di dag sdud pa'i byed pa po gzhan du 'dir 'gyur te gang gi phyir skyed pa'i byed pa po ni byed pa po ma yin no // de'i phyir mkha' khyab mkha' yi rdo rje can te yul dang rnam bral yon tan med la rang bzhin med pa'o zhes pa lhan cig skyes pa'i sku ste cha med kun 'gro khyab pa po zhes pa'o de'i phyir skyed pa dang sdud pa'i byed pa po dang mya
translated: In the moment of transference, etc., these agents, actions, and objects are included in another agent, because the agent of generation is not the agent.

original: ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid kyang med do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid kyang med do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the all-pervading one, the sky-vajra, free from objects, without qualities, and without intrinsic nature, is the innate body, the indivisible, omnipresent, and all-pervading one. Therefore, the agent of generation and the agent of inclusion, and also the characteristic of nirvana, do not exist. This is the meaning.

original: byed pa po zad pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa po zad pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: The ascertainment of the exhaustion of the agent.

original: da ni dri dang zhes pa la sogs pas tshogs pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni dri dang zhes pa la sogs pas tshogs pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, beginning with smell, etc., the collection, etc., are stated.

original: 'khor ba 'dir tshogs pa las skye ba ste chos gcig las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'khor ba 'dir tshogs pa las skye ba ste chos gcig las ni ma yin no //
translated: In this cyclic existence, arising is from a collection, not from a single phenomenon.

original: 'dir tshogs pa ni dri dang kha dog dang ni ro dang reg pa zhes dang 'dzin ma dang ni chu dang me dang rlung /
analyzed: 'dir tshogs pa ni dri dang kha dog dang ni ro dang reg pa zhes dang 'dzin ma dang ni chu dang me dang rlung /
translated: Here, the collection of objects is the eight substances, smell, color, taste, touch, earth, water, fire, and air.

original: zhes pa gzugs @268a * //
analyzed: zhes pa gzugs @268a * //
translated: Form is the collection of objects.

original: can brgyad po 'di dag rnams ni mtha' dag yul gyi tshogs pa dag ste gcig ni gtso bor 'gyur zhes pa ste gzugs can brgyad po 'di dag las yon tan gcig gi gtso bor 'gyur zhing lhag ma phal bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ni sngar brjod zin to
analyzed: can brgyad po 'di dag rnams ni mtha' dag yul gyi tshogs pa dag ste gcig ni gtso bor 'gyur zhes pa ste gzugs can brgyad po 'di dag las yon tan gcig gi gtso bor 'gyur zhing lhag ma phal bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ni sngar brjod zin to
translated: One of these eight substances becomes the principal substance, and the rest become secondary.üîΩSound, space, the realm of phenomena, and mind are the lords of humans.

original: // sgra dang stong pa dang ni chos kyi dbyings dang yid kyang mi yi bdag po gzugs med du 'gyur ro zhes pa ni gzugs med bzhi po rnams te /
analyzed: // sgra dang stong pa dang ni chos kyi dbyings dang yid kyang mi yi bdag po gzugs med du 'gyur ro zhes pa ni gzugs med bzhi po rnams te /
translated: They are the four formless [absorptions].

original: 'dir stong pa'i sgras khu ba'i khams brjod do //
analyzed: 'dir stong pa'i sgras khu ba'i khams brjod do //
translated: Here, the word space refers to the semen element.üîΩThis entire triple world expands and contracts by the power of time.

original: 'jig rten gsum po mtha' dag 'di ni spro  bdag dang sdud par 'gyur te dus kyi mthu las so zhes pa 'pho ba'i skad cig gis mthu las so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum po mtha' dag 'di ni spro  bdag dang sdud par 'gyur te dus kyi mthu las so zhes pa 'pho ba'i skad cig gis mthu las so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This means by the power of the moment of transition.

original: tshogs pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: The certainty of the assembly.

original: da ni bdag nyid 'ching ste zhes pa la sogs pas 'khor ba'i 'ching ba gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni bdag nyid 'ching ste zhes pa la sogs pas 'khor ba'i 'ching ba gsungs te /
translated: Now, ‚Äúone‚Äôs own binding‚Äù and so on explain the bondage of sa·πÉsƒÅra.

original: 'dir lus la phung po'i ngar 'dzin pa tsam ni 'khor ba ste bdag nyid kyis bdag nyid 'ching ngo //
analyzed: 'dir lus la phung po'i ngar 'dzin pa tsam ni 'khor ba ste bdag nyid kyis bdag nyid 'ching ngo //
translated: Here, the mere grasping of the aggregates in the body is sa·πÉsƒÅra, and one binds oneself.

original: rang bzhin la gnas yon tan rnam rtog rnams kyis zhes pa la rang bzhin ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi tshogs pa ste de la gnas pa'i yon tan skye ba dang 'gag pa'i mtshan nyid dri la sogs pa rnams dang / 'khor ba'i sems kyi dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid rnams te /
analyzed: rang bzhin la gnas yon tan rnam rtog rnams kyis zhes pa la rang bzhin ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi tshogs pa ste de la gnas pa'i yon tan skye ba dang 'gag pa'i mtshan nyid dri la sogs pa rnams dang / 'khor ba'i sems kyi dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid rnams te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe qualities that abide in the nature, the concepts‚Äù means that the nature is the assembly of the aggregates, dhƒÅtus, and ƒÅyatanas. The qualities that abide in that are the characteristics of the arising and ceasing of smell, and so on. The characteristics of the concepts of existence and nonexistence of the mind of sa·πÉsƒÅra are the characteristics of the arising and ceasing of smell, and so on.

original: rang bzhin la gnas yon tan rnams rtog de dag rnams kyis bdag nyid 'ching bar byed de rang gi lus las byung ba'i skud pa rnams kyis bdag nyid 'ching bar byed pa  dar gyi srin bu ji bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin la gnas yon tan rnams rtog de dag rnams kyis bdag nyid 'ching bar byed de rang gi lus las byung ba'i skud pa rnams kyis bdag nyid 'ching bar byed pa  dar gyi srin bu ji bzhin nyid do //
translated: The self is bound by those very qualities that abide in its nature, just as a silkworm is bound by the threads that emerge from itself.

original: bdag nyid bdag gis nges par slar yang rnam par rtog pa med pa'i yid dag las ni gtong bar byed ces pa ni slar yang bdag de rang bzhin la gnas yon tan rnam rtog rnams kyis btang ba ni rnam par rtog pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid bdag gis nges par slar yang rnam par rtog pa med pa'i yid dag las ni gtong bar byed ces pa ni slar yang bdag de rang bzhin la gnas yon tan rnam rtog rnams kyis btang ba ni rnam par rtog pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The self is released by the mind that is free from conceptualization, which is itself. The self is released from the qualities that abide in its nature and that are conceptualizations.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i yid de las bdag nyid 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las gtong bar byed do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i yid de las bdag nyid 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las gtong bar byed do //
translated: From that mind that is free from conceptualization, the self is released from the suffering of cyclic existence.

original: de'i phyir rgyal po rang las rang bzhin yon tan la gnas sdug bsngal dang ni bde ba byed pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyal po rang las rang bzhin yon tan la gnas sdug bsngal dang ni bde ba byed pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the king is the one who creates both suffering and happiness for himself, who abides in his own nature and qualities.

original: rang bzhin rnam par bral ba ste khams bco brgyad dang bral ba su zhig byed po ci zhig byed de mi byed do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rang bzhin rnam par bral ba ste khams bco brgyad dang bral ba su zhig byed po ci zhig byed de mi byed do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Who is the agent? What is the action? It means that nothing is done.

original: mi shes 'jig rten log pa'i bdag nyid kyis byed @268b pa po yongs su brtags pas rmongs par byed do //
analyzed: mi shes 'jig rten log pa'i bdag nyid kyis byed @268b pa po yongs su brtags pas rmongs par byed do //
translated: The ignorant world is deluded by the imagination of an agent due to its false nature.

original: las kyi 'ching ba'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi 'ching ba'i nges pa'o //
translated: The certainty of the bondage of karma.

original: da ni sa zhes pa la sogs pas sa la sogs pa rnam pa brgyad kyi rang bzhin gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni sa zhes pa la sogs pas sa la sogs pa rnam pa brgyad kyi rang bzhin gsungs te /
translated: Now, beginning with earth, he speaks of the nature of the eight, beginning with earth.

original: 'dir lus la dang po 'khor ba'i sems kyi rang bzhin rnam pa brgyad de sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha' dang yid dang blo dang  ngar 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid dang rnam pa brgyad do /
analyzed: 'dir lus la dang po 'khor ba'i sems kyi rang bzhin rnam pa brgyad de sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha' dang yid dang blo dang  ngar 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid dang rnam pa brgyad do /
translated: Here, in the body, there are eight natures of the beginning mind of samsara: earth, water, fire, wind, space, mind, intellect, and the nature of ego-grasping. These are the eight.

original: 'di dag kyang rnam gsum ste rags dang phra mo gzhan yang rnam gsum yon tan la gnas te snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i yon tan rnams la gnas pa ni yon tan la gnas pa'o ;
analyzed: 'di dag kyang rnam gsum ste rags dang phra mo gzhan yang rnam gsum yon tan la gnas te snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i yon tan rnams la gnas pa ni yon tan la gnas pa'o ;
translated: These are also threefold: coarse, subtle, and other. Again, threefold, abiding in the qualities, abiding in the qualities of sattva, rajas, and tamas.

original: / yi ge thig le la sogs pa'i dbye ba yis rags par rags pa'i dbang po rnams la gnas te blun po'i bag chags 'dzin par byed pa rags pa'i sems kyi sad pa'i gnas skabs kyi chos can ni rags pa ste sad pa'i dngos po 'dzin par byedüîΩpa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / yi ge thig le la sogs pa'i dbye ba yis rags par rags pa'i dbang po rnams la gnas te blun po'i bag chags 'dzin par byed pa rags pa'i sems kyi sad pa'i gnas skabs kyi chos can ni rags pa ste sad pa'i dngos po 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The gross mind is the subject of the state of waking, which is the support of the gross senses, such as the eye, by means of the divisions of the letters, the bindu, and so forth, and which holds the traces of the fool. It is gross because it holds the things of waking.

original: phra mo'i sems kyi phra mo ni rmi lam gyi gnas skabs kyi chos can te yid bzhin gyi dbang po rnams kyis sgyu ma lta bu'i dngos po 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phra mo'i sems kyi phra mo ni rmi lam gyi gnas skabs kyi chos can te yid bzhin gyi dbang po rnams kyis sgyu ma lta bu'i dngos po 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The subtle mind is the subject of the state of dreaming, which holds the illusory things by means of the mental senses.

original: phra mo gzhan yang dbang po thams cad 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid shin tu gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs kyi chos can ni gzhan te bltar med pa zhes brjod pa dang gcig tu gyur pa zhes pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid de dngos po thams cad yongs su btangüîΩba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phra mo gzhan yang dbang po thams cad 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid shin tu gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs kyi chos can ni gzhan te bltar med pa zhes brjod pa dang gcig tu gyur pa zhes pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid de dngos po thams cad yongs su btangüîΩba'i phyir ro //
translated: The other subtle mind is the subject of the state of deep sleep, which is characterized by the cessation of all the senses. It is different because it is said to be invisible, to be of one taste, and so forth, and because it is the total abandonment of all things.

original: de ltar rnam pa gsum ni snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i dbye bas sad pa dang rmi lam dang shin tu gnyid log pa'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gsum ni snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i dbye bas sad pa dang rmi lam dang shin tu gnyid log pa'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: Thus, these three are of the nature of the waking state, dream state, and deep sleep state, respectively, due to the distinctions of sattva, rajas, and tamas.

original: rags pa ni nyin mo'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rags pa ni nyin mo'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The gross is of the nature of the day.

original: phra mo ni thun mtshams kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: phra mo ni thun mtshams kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The subtle is of the nature of the twilight.

original: gzhan ni mtshan mo chen po'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan ni mtshan mo chen po'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The other is of the nature of the great night.

original: yang yig las gzhan bzhi pa'i rang bzhin ye shes kyi sku ste /
analyzed: yang yig las gzhan bzhi pa'i rang bzhin ye shes kyi sku ste /
translated: The fourth nature, which is different from the other three, is the body of wisdom.

original: de ni khu ba 'pho ba'i dus su ye shes kyi sems te bzhi pa'i sems kyi bzhi pa'i gnas skabs kyi chos can te /
analyzed: de ni khu ba 'pho ba'i dus su ye shes kyi sems te bzhi pa'i sems kyi bzhi pa'i gnas skabs kyi chos can te /
translated: It is the mind of wisdom at the time of the emission of semen, the fourth state of the fourth mind.

original: sems can rnams kyi skye ba dang 'gog pa'i rgyur gyur pa gang yin pa de'i phyir ye shes kyi sku'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi skye ba dang 'gog pa'i rgyur gyur pa gang yin pa de'i phyir ye shes kyi sku'o //
translated: It is the body of wisdom because it is the cause of the birth and cessation of sentient beings.

original: de yang rang bzhin rnam 'gyur med pa'i 'tsho ba 'byung ba ste srog chen po 'byung ba chos kyi khams kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin rnam 'gyur med pa'i 'tsho ba 'byung ba ste srog chen po 'byung ba chos kyi khams kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Moreover, it is the life of the nature of non-manifestation, the great life force, the nature of the element of phenomena.

original: 'byung ba min zhes pa ni 'byung ba @269a * //
analyzed: 'byung ba min zhes pa ni 'byung ba @269a * //
translated: ‚ÄúNot an element‚Äù means

original: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang khu ba ni 'byung ba ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang khu ba ni 'byung ba ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: earth, water, fire, air, and semen are not elements.

original: de ltar 'khor ba'i sems kyi rang bzhin gyi sad pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa bzhir nges pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'khor ba'i sems kyi rang bzhin gyi sad pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa bzhir nges pa'o //
translated: Thus, the nature of the mind of samsƒÅra is ascertained as four aspects by the divisions of waking and so on.üîΩNow, in order to explain the names of the fourth and so on, he says ‚Äúthe five

original: da ni aa sogs zhes pa la sogs pas bzhi pa la sogs pa rnams kyi ming gi chos gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni aa sogs zhes pa la sogs pas bzhi pa la sogs pa rnams kyi ming gi chos gsungs te /
translated: emptinesses of a, and so on,‚Äù and so on.üîΩThe names of the object of knowledge and the knower in this samsƒÅra are

original: 'khor ba 'dir rig par bya ba dang rig par byed po dag gi ming ni don rab tu go bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba 'dir rig par bya ba dang rig par byed po dag gi ming ni don rab tu go bar byed pa ste /
translated: the words that make the meaning understood.

original: de yang brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyis gnas so //
analyzed: de yang brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyis gnas so //
translated: Moreover, they exist by the characteristic of the expressed and the expresser.üîΩAmong them, the five emptinesses of a, and so on, are the nature of pristine

original: de la ye shes kyi rang bzhin las aa sogs stong pa lnga ni gzhom du med pa'i aa la sogs pa ste ;
analyzed: de la ye shes kyi rang bzhin las aa sogs stong pa lnga ni gzhom du med pa'i aa la sogs pa ste ;
translated: consciousness. The five emptinesses of a, and so on, are the indestructibleüîΩa, and so on.

original: gzhom du med pa ni dbus su aa yig stong pa'o //üîΩshar du ai yig stong pa'o //
analyzed: gzhom du med pa ni dbus su aa yig stong pa'o // shar du ai yig stong pa'o //
translated: The indestructible is the emptiness of the letter a in the center.üîΩThe emptiness of the letter i is in the east.

original: lhor ri yig stong pa'o //
analyzed: lhor ri yig stong pa'o //
translated: The emptiness of the letter i is in the south.

original: byang du au yig stong pa'o //
analyzed: byang du au yig stong pa'o //
translated: In the north, the letter u is emptiness.üîΩIn the west, the letter li is emptiness.

original: nub tu li yig stong pa'o zhes pa ste aa sogs stong pa lnga ni rang bzhin te rnam par 'gyur ba min mo //
analyzed: nub tu li yig stong pa'o zhes pa ste aa sogs stong pa lnga ni rang bzhin te rnam par 'gyur ba min mo //
translated: The five emptinesses of a, etc., are the nature, not the transformations.üîΩThe glorious parts, drops, nadas,üîΩtimes, minds, and understandings,

original: dpal ldan cha dang thig le n'a da dang ; dus dang sems dang blo ste zhes pa la cha ste nyi ma dang thig le ste zla ba dang n'a da ste sgra gcan dang dus te dus me dang sems dang blo dang rang bzhin dag kyang shin tu gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs kyi chos can no /
analyzed: dpal ldan cha dang thig le n'a da dang ; dus dang sems dang blo ste zhes pa la cha ste nyi ma dang thig le ste zla ba dang n'a da ste sgra gcan dang dus te dus me dang sems dang blo dang rang bzhin dag kyang shin tu gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs kyi chos can no /
translated: the parts, that is, the sun, the drops, that is, the moon, the nadas, that is, Rahu, the times, that is, the time fire, the minds, the understandings, and the natures, are the phenomena of the state of deep sleep.

original: gzhan pa'i dbyangs ni rlung la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan pa'i dbyangs ni rlung la sogs pa'o //
translated: The other vowels are the winds, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras nam mkha' la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras nam mkha' la sogs pa ste /
translated: The word etc. includes space, etc.

original: aa ai ri au li //
analyzed: aa ai ri au li //
translated: A i r i u lüîΩa e a r a o a l

original: aa ae aa ra ao aa la /üîΩha ya ra wa la rnams so //
analyzed: aa ae aa ra ao aa la / ha ya ra wa la rnams so //
translated: h y r v l

original: de bzhin du ring po ste rmi lam gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du ring po ste rmi lam gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Likewise, the long ones are the nature of dreams.

original: rags pa'i sde pa'i yi ge dbyangs bcu gnyis dang bcas pa sum brgya drug cu rnams ni sad pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rags pa'i sde pa'i yi ge dbyangs bcu gnyis dang bcas pa sum brgya drug cu rnams ni sad pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The three hundred and sixty consonants together with the twelve vowels are the nature of the waking state.üîΩThe other sixteen are the gross transformations.

original: bcu drug gzhan ni rnam 'gyur rags pa'o zhes pa ste yi ge so so re re'i dbyangs bco lngas bzung ba gsal byed dang bcas pa ni rnam par 'gyur ba bcu drug go //
analyzed: bcu drug gzhan ni rnam 'gyur rags pa'o zhes pa ste yi ge so so re re'i dbyangs bco lngas bzung ba gsal byed dang bcas pa ni rnam par 'gyur ba bcu drug go //
translated: Each of the individual consonants together with the fifteen vowels is a transformation.

original: thams cad du khams lnga dang las kyi dbang po lnga dang yul lnga ni rnam par 'gyur ba ste yid dang lhan cig bcu drug go //
analyzed: thams cad du khams lnga dang las kyi dbang po lnga dang yul lnga ni rnam par 'gyur ba ste yid dang lhan cig bcu drug go //
translated: In all cases, the five elements, the five organs of action, and the five objects are the transformations, together with the mind, making sixteen.

original: sa la sogs pa 'di dag gi dbus su rdo rje can ni rang bzhin min zhing rnam 'gyur min te khyab byed rang bzhin med pa'o //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa 'di dag gi dbus su rdo rje can ni rang bzhin min zhing rnam 'gyur min te khyab byed rang bzhin med pa'o //
translated: In the middle of these, earth and so on, is the possessor of the vajra, which is neither the nature nor the transformation. It is the pervading nature that is not a transformation.

original: gang gi phyir 'khor ba'i bag chags las grol ba'i sems kyi chos yin pa de'i phyir gang sems yod pa'i sems de ni sems ma yin no zhes 'khor ba'i sems dang bral ba mya ngan @269b las 'das pa'i sems gzhan yod pa ni rdo rje can gyi ming
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'khor ba'i bag chags las grol ba'i sems kyi chos yin pa de'i phyir gang sems yod pa'i sems de ni sems ma yin no zhes 'khor ba'i sems dang bral ba mya ngan @269b las 'das pa'i sems gzhan yod pa ni rdo rje can gyi ming
translated: Because it is the dharma of mind liberated from the latent tendencies of sa·πÉsƒÅra, therefore, the mind that exists as mind is not mind.

original: gis bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: gis bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed One, the Vajra Holder, has said that there is another mind of nirvƒÅ·πáa, free from the mind of sa·πÉsƒÅra.

original: rang bzhin rnam pa bzhi'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin rnam pa bzhi'i nges pa'o //
translated: The ascertainment of the four natures.

original: da ni 'khor bar zhes pa la sogs pas sems can rnams rang gi las kyi 'bras bu la nye bar longs spyod pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni 'khor bar zhes pa la sogs pas sems can rnams rang gi las kyi 'bras bu la nye bar longs spyod pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, beginning with ‚ÄúIn this sa·πÉsƒÅra,‚Äù he explains that sentient beings enjoy the fruits of their own actions.

original: 'khor ba 'dir sems can bde ba'am sdug bsngal ba'am bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba rang bzhin yon tan la gnas ni snga rjod pa'i yon tan la gnas pa ste rang gis byas pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'khor ba 'dir sems can bde ba'am sdug bsngal ba'am bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba rang bzhin yon tan la gnas ni snga rjod pa'i yon tan la gnas pa ste rang gis byas pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: In this sa·πÉsƒÅra, sentient beings abide in the qualities of happiness, suffering, or both happiness and suffering, which are natural qualities. Abiding in the qualities means abiding in the previously mentioned qualities, which is to say, they are self-produced.

original: las las skyes pa de ni za ba ste rang gis byas pa'i las kyis bskyed pa ni las las skyes pa ste longs spyod do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: las las skyes pa de ni za ba ste rang gis byas pa'i las kyis bskyed pa ni las las skyes pa ste longs spyod do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: That which is born from karma is the enjoyer, that is, generated by the karma one has done. The meaning is that it is the enjoyment.

original: de nyid ni 'dir lus dang ngag dang sems kyi dbang gis rnam pa gsum ste rags pa dang phra mo dang zhi ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni 'dir lus dang ngag dang sems kyi dbang gis rnam pa gsum ste rags pa dang phra mo dang zhi ba'o //
translated: That itself is threefold here, gross, subtle, and peaceful, by the power of body, speech, and mind.

original: gzhan yang rnam pa gsum ste khyad par gyi las dang las ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam pa gsum ste khyad par gyi las dang las ma yin pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is threefold, as special karma and non-karma.

original: de dag las gang zhig bdag ni byed pa po'o zhes pa'i sems bskyed pa de ni khyad par gyi las kyi ming can no //
analyzed: de dag las gang zhig bdag ni byed pa po'o zhes pa'i sems bskyed pa de ni khyad par gyi las kyi ming can no //
translated: Among those, the one who generates the thought I am the agent is called special karma.

original: gang zhig byed pa po gzhan pa phyugs bdag gam gzhan yod pa'i sems skye ba de ni las kyi ming can no //
analyzed: gang zhig byed pa po gzhan pa phyugs bdag gam gzhan yod pa'i sems skye ba de ni las kyi ming can no //
translated: The one who generates the thought The other, the owner of the cattle, is the agent is called karma.

original: byed po bdag gam gzhan pa min te rang bzhin rnam par bral ba phung po la sogs pa'i tshogs pa dang bral ba gang zhig sems bskyed pa de ni las ma yin pa'i ming can no //
analyzed: byed po bdag gam gzhan pa min te rang bzhin rnam par bral ba phung po la sogs pa'i tshogs pa dang bral ba gang zhig sems bskyed pa de ni las ma yin pa'i ming can no //
translated: The one who generates the thought Neither the self nor the other is the agent, free from inherent nature, free from the collection of aggregates and so on is called non-karma.

original: de ltar bdag dang gzhan byed pa por 'dzin pa dang bral bar shes pa gang yin pa de'i las ni byed pa pos byas pa ma yin zhing byed pa po ni rgyur gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar bdag dang gzhan byed pa por 'dzin pa dang bral bar shes pa gang yin pa de'i las ni byed pa pos byas pa ma yin zhing byed pa po ni rgyur gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: The action of one who knows thus, free from grasping at self and other as agents, is not made by an agent, and the agent is not a cause.

original: las las skye ba ni tshogs pa'i dbang gis te ji ltar s'a li'i sa bon las s'a li 'grub pa de bzhin du dge ba'i las las dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu 'grub bo //
analyzed: las las skye ba ni tshogs pa'i dbang gis te ji ltar s'a li'i sa bon las s'a li 'grub pa de bzhin du dge ba'i las las dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu 'grub bo //
translated: Arising from action is by the power of the collection, just as rice is established from a rice seed, so the result of virtuous action is established from virtuous action.

original: ji ltar ko dra ba'i sa bon las ko dra ba 'grub pa de bzhin du mi dge ba'i las las mi dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu 'grub ste rang las ma yin zhing gzhan las kyang ma yin no zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba las brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar ko dra ba'i sa bon las ko dra ba 'grub pa de bzhin du mi dge ba'i las las mi dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu 'grub ste rang las ma yin zhing gzhan las kyang ma yin no zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba las brjod par bya'o //
translated: Just as kodrava is established from a kodrava seed, so the result of non-virtuous action is established from non-virtuous action. It is not from itself, nor from another, as will be explained in the chapter on action.

original: las kyi 'bras bu nges pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi 'bras bu nges pa'o //
translated: The certainty of the result of action.

original: da ni de phyir zhes pa la sogs pas byed pa po med par 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i las gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni de phyir zhes pa la sogs pas byed pa po med par 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i las gsungs te /
translated: Now, beginning with ‚ÄúTherefore,‚Äù he speaks of action with result, without an agent.

original: 'khor ba 'dir byed pa po 'ga' yang srog chags rnams kyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag mi sbyin mi 'phrog ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba 'dir byed pa po 'ga' yang srog chags rnams kyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag mi sbyin mi 'phrog ste /
translated: In this samsara, no creator god bestows or takes away the happiness and suffering of living beings.

original: @270a * // gang gi phyir rnam pa gsum po gang byas sngon gyi las rang gis byas pa ni 'bras bu rab tu sbyin par 'gyur ba de'i phyir byed pa po 'ga' yang mi sbyin zhing mi 'phrog go zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: @270a * // gang gi phyir rnam pa gsum po gang byas sngon gyi las rang gis byas pa ni 'bras bu rab tu sbyin par 'gyur ba de'i phyir byed pa po 'ga' yang mi sbyin zhing mi 'phrog go zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Because the three types of karma that one has previously created will yield their results, therefore no creator god bestows or takes away.

original: skyed dang sdud pa'i byed pa po 'di ster zhing de ni 'phrog pa rmongs pa rnams kyi blo gros te /
analyzed: skyed dang sdud pa'i byed pa po 'di ster zhing de ni 'phrog pa rmongs pa rnams kyi blo gros te /
translated: The creator god bestows and takes away the creation and destruction of the world, and that is the deluded understanding of fools.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na gang zhig rang gi lus la dpag med dge ba 'phrog par byed pa'i bug pa rang gi dbang po dag gis mthong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na gang zhig rang gi lus la dpag med dge ba 'phrog par byed pa'i bug pa rang gi dbang po dag gis mthong ba ma yin te /
translated: Why? Because the holes in one‚Äôs body through which immeasurable virtue is lost are not seen by one‚Äôs own senses.

original: rang gi dbang po phyi rol du yul drug la 'jug cing nang du zag pa med pa'i bde ba dang bral ba rnams kyis so //
analyzed: rang gi dbang po phyi rol du yul drug la 'jug cing nang du zag pa med pa'i bde ba dang bral ba rnams kyis so //
translated: One‚Äôs senses engage with the six external objects and are divorced from internal uncontaminated bliss.

original: rang gi las kyi 'bras bu nye bar longs spyod pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi las kyi 'bras bu nye bar longs spyod pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: The definite experience of the result of one's own action.

original: da ni 'dod pa zhes pa la sogs pas 'dod pa la sogs pa'i byed pa po phan tshun dngos po yang dag par sbyor ba med pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni 'dod pa zhes pa la sogs pas 'dod pa la sogs pa'i byed pa po phan tshun dngos po yang dag par sbyor ba med pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, he declares the mutual non-application of the agent of desire, etc., by desire, etc.

original: 'dir 'gro ba sems can rnams kyi rang gi yid la 'dod pa'i nus pa gang yin pa rnams dngos po rnams gsal bar byed de yid 'jug par byed do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'dir 'gro ba sems can rnams kyi rang gi yid la 'dod pa'i nus pa gang yin pa rnams dngos po rnams gsal bar byed de yid 'jug par byed do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Here, whatever is the power of the mind of beings, of the world, that is the manifestation of things, the engagement of the mind, is the meaning.

original: bya ba ni dngos po rnams la 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: bya ba ni dngos po rnams la 'jug par byed do //
translated: Action is the engagement of things.

original: ye shes nus pa ni dngos po ro mnyam rgyur ni don la nye bar dmigs par byed de don nges pa ni ye shes nges pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: ye shes nus pa ni dngos po ro mnyam rgyur ni don la nye bar dmigs par byed de don nges pa ni ye shes nges pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The power of intuition is the observation of the object as the cause of the equal flavor of things. The ascertainment of the object is the ascertainment of intuition, is the meaning.

original: slar yang gtong ba ste sngar gyi ye shes gtong ba dag ni bzhi pa srid gsum gyis btud gnyis med kyis nges par rim par byed do zhes pa ni yid kyi nus pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: slar yang gtong ba ste sngar gyi ye shes gtong ba dag ni bzhi pa srid gsum gyis btud gnyis med kyis nges par rim par byed do zhes pa ni yid kyi nus pa bzhi'o //
translated: Again, the relinquishment of the former ascertainment of intuition is the fourth, which is the bowing of the three worlds, the non-dual ascertainment, is the meaning. These are the four powers of the mind.

original: bzhi po de dag gi nang nas gang zhig rnam par dag pa'i sems kyi bdag nyid rdo rje can ni gsal ba dang 'jug pa dang ro mnyam rgyur don la nye bar dmigs pa cung zad mi za zhing ye shes gtong ba'i gtong ba min pa nyid do
analyzed: bzhi po de dag gi nang nas gang zhig rnam par dag pa'i sems kyi bdag nyid rdo rje can ni gsal ba dang 'jug pa dang ro mnyam rgyur don la nye bar dmigs pa cung zad mi za zhing ye shes gtong ba'i gtong ba min pa nyid do
translated: From among those four, the one who is the nature of the pure mind, the vajra-holder, is not the giver who slightly partakes of the object of observation, clarity, engagement, and the same taste, and is not the giver who gives the gnosis.

original: zhes pa ste 'dod pa la sogs pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ste 'dod pa la sogs pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the definition of desire and so forth.

original: da ni bdag ces pa la sogs pas bde ba dang sdug bsngal rab tu sbyin par byed pa po gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni bdag ces pa la sogs pas bde ba dang sdug bsngal rab tu sbyin par byed pa po gsungs te /
translated: Now, beginning with ‚Äúthe self,‚Äù he speaks of the giver of the highest bliss and suffering:

original: 'khor bar bdag ni byed po sdug bsngal dang bde ba dag rab tu sbyin pa por mi yi bdag po der ni 'gyur ba min srid pa gsum gyi gnas na bde ba dang sdug bsngal rab tu sbyin pa po 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'khor bar bdag ni byed po sdug bsngal dang bde ba dag rab tu sbyin pa por mi yi bdag po der ni 'gyur ba min srid pa gsum gyi gnas na bde ba dang sdug bsngal rab tu sbyin pa po 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In cyclic existence, the self is not the giver of the highest suffering and bliss, the lord of men. In the three existences, there is no giver of the highest bliss and suffering.

original: sems kyi nus pa de rnams rnam par spangs nas so //
analyzed: sems kyi nus pa de rnams rnam par spangs nas so //
translated: Having abandoned those potentials of the mind,

original: 'dir sems kyi nus pa ni sad pa dang rmi lam dang shin tu gnyid log pa dang bzhi pa'i mtshan nyid de de @270b dag gi gtso bo ni bzhi pa skye ba dang 'gog pa'i chos can gyi gnas skabs te sems kyi nus pa spangs nas bdag ni
analyzed: 'dir sems kyi nus pa ni sad pa dang rmi lam dang shin tu gnyid log pa dang bzhi pa'i mtshan nyid de de @270b dag gi gtso bo ni bzhi pa skye ba dang 'gog pa'i chos can gyi gnas skabs te sems kyi nus pa spangs nas bdag ni
translated: Here, the capacity of the mind is characterized by the four states of waking, dreaming, deep sleep, and the fourth. The principal among them is the state of the fourth, which is characterized by the arising and cessation of the mind. Having abandoned the capacity of the mind, the self

original: byed pa po bde dang sdug bsngal rab tu sbyin pa po 'ga' yang med do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa po bde dang sdug bsngal rab tu sbyin pa po 'ga' yang med do zhes pa'o //
translated: is not at all an agent or the bestower of pleasure and pain.

original: sems can rnams kyi khu ba 'pho ba spangs nas bcings pa dang grol ba gzhan 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi khu ba 'pho ba spangs nas bcings pa dang grol ba gzhan 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Having abandoned the emission of semen in sentient beings, there is no other bondage or liberation.

original: 'khor ba'i sems spangs nas so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sems spangs nas so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that having abandoned the mind of sa·πÉsƒÅra.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i sems 'khor ba las 'das pa lus thams cad la gnas pa ni gang gis kyang ma bcings shing ma bkrol ba'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i sems 'khor ba las 'das pa lus thams cad la gnas pa ni gang gis kyang ma bcings shing ma bkrol ba'o //
translated: The mind of nirvƒÅ·πáa, which transcends sa·πÉsƒÅra, is not bound or liberated by anything, as it abides in all bodies.

original: nam mkha' bum pa'i dbus nas chu ni len par byed pa na yang 'gro ba min pa ji lta ba /
analyzed: nam mkha' bum pa'i dbus nas chu ni len par byed pa na yang 'gro ba min pa ji lta ba /
translated: Just as when one takes water from the middle of a pot, there is no going.

original: mkha' khyab mkha' yi rdo rje can zhes pa ste stong pa la sogs pa'i rnam par thar pas rnam par dag pa'i sems ni mkha' yi rdo rje can no //
analyzed: mkha' khyab mkha' yi rdo rje can zhes pa ste stong pa la sogs pa'i rnam par thar pas rnam par dag pa'i sems ni mkha' yi rdo rje can no //
translated: The one who is endowed with the sky-vajra is the mind purified by the liberation of emptiness, etc.

original: yul dang rnam bral zhes pa yon tan med pa ste de tsam la sogs pa dang snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: yul dang rnam bral zhes pa yon tan med pa ste de tsam la sogs pa dang snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa dang bral ba ste /
translated: Free from objects is devoid of qualities, and free from that much, etc., sattva, rajas, and tamas.

original: sad pa dang rmi lam dang shin tu gnyid log pa dang bzhi pa dang bral ba zhes pa'i don te rang bzhin med pa lus kyi dbus dag tu yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: sad pa dang rmi lam dang shin tu gnyid log pa dang bzhi pa dang bral ba zhes pa'i don te rang bzhin med pa lus kyi dbus dag tu yang de bzhin no //
translated: Free from the four states of waking, dreaming, deep sleep, and the fourth, is the meaning.

original: rtag pa dngos po dang chad pa dngos po med pa ste de dag gang la med pa de ni rdo rje can te rnam par dag pa'i sems so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rtag pa dngos po dang chad pa dngos po med pa ste de dag gang la med pa de ni rdo rje can te rnam par dag pa'i sems so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The one who is devoid of existence and non-existence is the mind of liberation.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i sems nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i sems nges pa'o //
translated: The mind of samsara and nirvana is ascertained.

original: da ni de ltar zhes pa la sogs pa las smra ba gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni de ltar zhes pa la sogs pa las smra ba gsungs te /
translated: Now, the speech is stated beginning with ‚Äúthus,‚Äù etc.

original: de ltar brjod pa'i rim pa las yod par smra ba po dang byed pa po med par gang smra ba bo dang bdag med par gang smra ba por 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar brjod pa'i rim pa las yod par smra ba po dang byed pa po med par gang smra ba bo dang bdag med par gang smra ba por 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, from the point of view of the one who speaks in this way, the one who speaks of the nonexistence of the agent and the one who speaks of the nonexistence of the self becomes the one who speaks.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par dag pa'i sems kyi bdag nyid yod min med min yod med min //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par dag pa'i sems kyi bdag nyid yod min med min yod med min //
translated: The Lord is not the self of the pure mind, not the nonexistence of the self, not the existence of the nonexistence of the self,

original: gnyis ka'i bdag nyid min pa'ang min pa khams gsum gyi ston pa gcig pu de ni byed po min te /
analyzed: gnyis ka'i bdag nyid min pa'ang min pa khams gsum gyi ston pa gcig pu de ni byed po min te /
translated: and not the self of both. The one who is the teacher of the three realms, the one who is not the agent,

original: kun mkhyen dang po'i sangs rgyas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang lam mkhyen pa nyid dang lam gyi rnam pa mkhyen pa nyid thob pa /
analyzed: kun mkhyen dang po'i sangs rgyas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang lam mkhyen pa nyid dang lam gyi rnam pa mkhyen pa nyid thob pa /
translated: is the omniscient first buddha, the one who has attained the state of omniscience, the state of knowledge of all aspects, the state of knowledge of the path, and the state of knowledge of the aspects of the path.

original: srid gsum gyis btud dus kyi 'khor lo can zag pa med pa'i bde ba rnam pa thams cad pa'i chos can te 'khor lo can khyab 'jug ni ma yin no //
analyzed: srid gsum gyis btud dus kyi 'khor lo can zag pa med pa'i bde ba rnam pa thams cad pa'i chos can te 'khor lo can khyab 'jug ni ma yin no //
translated: He is the one who has the dharma of all aspects of undefiled bliss, the one who is bowed to by the three existences, the one who is not the cakravartin.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na gang las tshangs pa khyab 'jug drag po dag kyang @271a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na gang las tshangs pa khyab 'jug drag po dag kyang @271a * //
translated: Why is this? Because from him, BrahmƒÅ, Vi·π£·πáu, and Rudra,

original: gang gi zhabs kyi chu skyes drung du lhag par skyabs 'gro ba dus kyi 'khor lo de la phyag 'tshal lo zhes pa ni 'jam dpal bdag ste /
analyzed: gang gi zhabs kyi chu skyes drung du lhag par skyabs 'gro ba dus kyi 'khor lo de la phyag 'tshal lo zhes pa ni 'jam dpal bdag ste /
translated: I pay homage to that Kalachakra, in the presence of whose lotus feet I have gone for refuge.

original: rgyal ba mchog skyed yon tan med cing rnam rtog med pa ni sngar brjod pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rgyal ba mchog skyed yon tan med cing rnam rtog med pa ni sngar brjod pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The supreme Victor, who is without qualities and without conceptualization, is as described above.

original: stong pa nyid smra ba po'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid smra ba po'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the ascertainment of the one who speaks of emptiness.

original: da ni zhi ba zhes pa la sogs pas 'chi ba'i mthar bsam pa'i dbang gis skye ba gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni zhi ba zhes pa la sogs pas 'chi ba'i mthar bsam pa'i dbang gis skye ba gsungs te /
translated: Now, beginning with ‚Äúpeace,‚Äù he speaks of birth by the power of thought at the end of death.

original: 'khor ba 'dir sems can rnams kyi rang gi las kyi dbang gis snying stobs kyi yon tan la sogs pa'i bsam pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba 'dir sems can rnams kyi rang gi las kyi dbang gis snying stobs kyi yon tan la sogs pa'i bsam pa ste /
translated: In this cyclic existence, by the power of their own karma, beings have thoughts of the qualities of sattva and so on.

original: bsam pa de las skye ba'o //
analyzed: bsam pa de las skye ba'o //
translated: Birth comes from those thoughts.

original: 'dir 'chi ba'i dus su dge ba'i las kyi dbang gis zhi ba'i bsam par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir 'chi ba'i dus su dge ba'i las kyi dbang gis zhi ba'i bsam par 'gyur te /
translated: Here, at the time of death, by the power of virtuous karma, there is a thought of peace.

original: snying stobs kyi yon tan gyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: snying stobs kyi yon tan gyi bdag nyid do //
translated: It is the nature of the qualities of sattva.

original: bsam pa de skyes par gyur na shi ba'i mthar lha nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam pa de skyes par gyur na shi ba'i mthar lha nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: When that thought arises, at the end of death, one becomes a god.

original: mi yi bdag po zhes pa ni zla ba bzang po la bod pa'o //
analyzed: mi yi bdag po zhes pa ni zla ba bzang po la bod pa'o //
translated: The lord of men is the moon.

original: mi dge ba'i dbang gis bsam pa drag por 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i dbang gis bsam pa drag por 'gyur te /
translated: By the power of non-virtue, the mind becomes very strong.

original: mun pa'i yon tan gyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: mun pa'i yon tan gyi bdag nyid do //
translated: The mind is of the nature of darkness.

original: mun pa'i bsam pa de la dmyal ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mun pa'i bsam pa de la dmyal ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: When the mind is of the nature of darkness, it becomes hell.

original: mi dge ba 'bring po'i dbang gis rdul gyi bsam pa ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba 'bring po'i dbang gis rdul gyi bsam pa ste /
translated: By the power of medium non-virtue, the mind becomes of the nature of dust.

original: rdul gyi bsam pa der gyur na shi ba'i mthar dud 'gro nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdul gyi bsam pa der gyur na shi ba'i mthar dud 'gro nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: When the mind becomes of the nature of dust, at the end of death, it becomes an animal.

original: rab mchog sa yi steng du mi nyid dag ni 'dres pa la ste /
analyzed: rab mchog sa yi steng du mi nyid dag ni 'dres pa la ste /
translated: On the best earth, human birth is from a mixture.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba 'dres pa la mi nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba 'dres pa la mi nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Human birth is from a mixture of virtue and non-virtue.

original: 'byung po nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste rdul dang mun pa dang ni snying stobs phan tshun 'dres pa la'o //
analyzed: 'byung po nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste rdul dang mun pa dang ni snying stobs phan tshun 'dres pa la'o //
translated: The three types of beings are from the mixture of dust, darkness, and sattva.

original: 'dir snying stobs lhag pa la yi dags mchog go //
analyzed: 'dir snying stobs lhag pa la yi dags mchog go //
translated: Here, the best ghost is from the predominance of sattva.

original: rdul lhag pa la 'bring po'o //
analyzed: rdul lhag pa la 'bring po'o //
translated: The medium is from the predominance of dust.

original: mun pa lhag pa la tha ma'o //
analyzed: mun pa lhag pa la tha ma'o //
translated: The lowest is from the predominance of darkness.

original: lha ma yin rnams ni lha'i nang du 'dus pa nyid do //
analyzed: lha ma yin rnams ni lha'i nang du 'dus pa nyid do //
translated: The asuras are included among the gods.

original: de bzhin du mi rnams ni snying stobs lhag pa la bde ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi rnams ni snying stobs lhag pa la bde ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Likewise, those with an excess of sattva are happy.

original: rdul lhag pa la bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rdul lhag pa la bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Those with an excess of rajas are happy and miserable.

original: mun pa lhag pa la rtag tu sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mun pa lhag pa la rtag tu sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Those with an excess of tamas are always miserable.

original: de bzhin du mtho ris la sogs pa thams cad du yang sems can rnams kyi rang gi las kyi dbang gis las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa dpag tu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du mtho ris la sogs pa thams cad du yang sems can rnams kyi rang gi las kyi dbang gis las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa dpag tu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, in all the heavens and so forth, the ripening of the karma of sentient beings is immeasurable by the power of their own karma.

original: de'i phyir 'chi ba'i dus su yid kyis bsam pa gang zhig dran @271b par gyur pa der ni skye bo yang dag skye zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'chi ba'i dus su yid kyis bsam pa gang zhig dran @271b par gyur pa der ni skye bo yang dag skye zhes pa ste /
translated: Therefore, at the time of death, whatever is remembered by the mind, there the person is born.

original: bsam pa skye ba'i des pa'o //üîΩda ni lha nyid ces pa la sogs pas lha la sogs pa'i dbye ba gsungs te /
analyzed: bsam pa skye ba'i des pa'o // da ni lha nyid ces pa la sogs pas lha la sogs pa'i dbye ba gsungs te /
translated: The meaning is that the mind is born there.üîΩNow, beginning with ‚Äúthe gods,‚Äù he explains the divisions of the gods and so forth.

original: 'dir lha yi mchog gi gnas mtho ris su lha nyid brgyad kyi dbye ba dag gis 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir lha yi mchog gi gnas mtho ris su lha nyid brgyad kyi dbye ba dag gis 'gyur te /
translated: Here, in the heavenly realm of the gods, there are eight divisions of gods.

original: zad par sa dang ; zad par chu dang / zad pa med dang / zad par rlung dang / zad par stong pa dang / zad par zla ba dang / zad par nyi ma dang / zad par sgra gcan zhes bya ba bsgoms pa dang /
analyzed: zad par sa dang ; zad par chu dang / zad pa med dang / zad par rlung dang / zad par stong pa dang / zad par zla ba dang / zad par nyi ma dang / zad par sgra gcan zhes bya ba bsgoms pa dang /
translated: the sphere of mastery of the sphere of nothingness,üîΩthe sphere of mastery of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception,üîΩthe sphere of mastery of the cessation of perception and feeling.üîΩThe ten spheres of totality are:üîΩthe sphere of totality of earth,üîΩthe sphere of totality of water,

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams kyi stobs dang / mi dge ba bcu yongs su spangs pa ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams kyi stobs dang / mi dge ba bcu yongs su spangs pa ste /
translated: the sphere of totality of fire,üîΩthe sphere of totality of wind,

original: lha nyid brgyad kyi dbye ba dag gis 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha nyid brgyad kyi dbye ba dag gis 'gyur ro //
translated: the sphere of totality of the sky,üîΩthe sphere of totality of the sphere of infinite space,üîΩthe sphere of totality of the sphere of infinite consciousness,

original: mi nyid gcig ni ji lta ba khams drug gi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: mi nyid gcig ni ji lta ba khams drug gi bdag nyid do //
translated: the sphere of totality of the sphere of nothingness,üîΩthe sphere of totality of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception,üîΩthe sphere of totality of the cessation of perception and feeling.üîΩThe ten spheres of totality are:üîΩthe sphere of totality of earth,üîΩthe sphere of totality of water,üîΩthe sphere of totality of fire,üîΩthe sphere of totality of wind,

original: dud 'gro dag kyang chu gter rnam pa ste /
analyzed: dud 'gro dag kyang chu gter rnam pa ste /
translated: the sphere of totality of the sky,üîΩthe sphere of totality of the sphere of infinite space,üîΩthe sphere of totality of the sphere of infinite consciousness,

original: khams drug gi bdag nyid can rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: khams drug gi bdag nyid can rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: the sphere of totality of the sphere of nothingness,üîΩthe sphere of totality of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception,üîΩthe sphere of totality of the cessation of perception and feeling.üîΩThe ten spheres of totality are:üîΩthe sphere of totality of earth,üîΩthe sphere of totality of water,

original: dmyal ba'i 'gro bar dmyal ba nyid ni de bzhin gcig ste /
analyzed: dmyal ba'i 'gro bar dmyal ba nyid ni de bzhin gcig ste /
translated: the sphere of totality of fire,üîΩthe sphere of totality of wind,üîΩthe sphere of totality of the sky,üîΩthe sphere of totality of the sphere of infinite space,üîΩthe sphere of totality of the sphere of infinite consciousness,üîΩthe sphere of totality of the sphere of nothingness,üîΩthe sphere of totality of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception,

original: khams drug gi bag chags las byung ba rmi lam dang mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: khams drug gi bag chags las byung ba rmi lam dang mtshungs pa'o //
translated: the sphere of totality of the cessation of perception and feeling.üîΩThe ten spheres of totality are:

original: lha ma yin nyid ni lha'i nang du 'dus so //
analyzed: lha ma yin nyid ni lha'i nang du 'dus so //
translated: the sphere of totality of earth,üîΩthe sphere of totality of water,üîΩthe sphere of totality of fire,üîΩthe sphere of totality of wind,üîΩthe sphere of totality of the sky,üîΩthe sphere of totality of the sphere of infinite space,

original: yi dags nyid ni dmyal ba'i nang du 'dus te sdug bsngal la nye bar longs spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yi dags nyid ni dmyal ba'i nang du 'dus te sdug bsngal la nye bar longs spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The hungry ghosts are included within the hells, because they enjoy suffering.

original: skye ba brgyad dang gcig dang bzhi dang gci ste ;
analyzed: skye ba brgyad dang gcig dang bzhi dang gci ste ;
translated: Eight, one, four, and one,

original: gnas bcu bzhi po 'di rnams su ro yi 'gro bar zhes pa 'gro ba drug tu skye bo kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i chos can 'khor te /
analyzed: gnas bcu bzhi po 'di rnams su ro yi 'gro bar zhes pa 'gro ba drug tu skye bo kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i chos can 'khor te /
translated: in these fourteen places, the beings of the realm of hungry ghosts wander in the six realms,

original: las kyi zhags pas nges par bcings pa dag skyes pa 'bum phrag du mas las kyi zhags pa las grol ba min zhing thar pa mchog gi bde ba'i go 'phang du 'gro ba min no //
analyzed: las kyi zhags pas nges par bcings pa dag skyes pa 'bum phrag du mas las kyi zhags pa las grol ba min zhing thar pa mchog gi bde ba'i go 'phang du 'gro ba min no //
translated: bound by the noose of karma, not liberated from the noose of karma by hundreds of thousands of births, not going to the state of supreme bliss of liberation.

original: sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis lha la sogs pa'i dbye ba nges pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis lha la sogs pa'i dbye ba nges pa'o //
translated: By the power of the intention of sentient beings, the classification of gods and so forth is determined.

original: da ni phung po zhes pa la sogs pas 'ching ba'i rgyu gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni phung po zhes pa la sogs pas 'ching ba'i rgyu gsungs te /
translated: Now, the cause of bondage is stated beginning with ‚Äúaggregates,‚Äù and so forth.

original: 'gro ba drug gi 'khor ba 'dir 'tsho ba ste srog kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i chos can bcings te 'khor ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba drug gi 'khor ba 'dir 'tsho ba ste srog kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i chos can bcings te 'khor ro //
translated: In this cyclic existence of the six realms, life, the life of the basis consciousness, is bound and wanders.

original: gang gis zhe na phung po ste 'byung ba dang khams drug dang dbang po dang rnam gsum srid pa 'jigs pa yul drug dang / de tsam dang las kyi dbang po lnga dang / las kyi skyon dge ba dang mi dge ba dang yon tan dang bcas yid dang blo dang dar 'dzin la sogs te @272a * //
analyzed: gang gis zhe na phung po ste 'byung ba dang khams drug dang dbang po dang rnam gsum srid pa 'jigs pa yul drug dang / de tsam dang las kyi dbang po lnga dang / las kyi skyon dge ba dang mi dge ba dang yon tan dang bcas yid dang blo dang dar 'dzin la sogs te @272a * //
translated: By what? By the aggregates, that is, the six elements, the six sense faculties, the three realms, the six fears, the six objects, the five action faculties, the five action faults, virtue and nonvirtue, the mind with its qualities, the intellect, the apprehender of the subtle, and so on.

original: sogs pa'i sgras srog gi nus pa'i rtsa ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras srog gi nus pa'i rtsa ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The term ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes the nature of the root of the power of life.

original: 'di dag gis bcings 'tsho ba dag ni ro yis 'gro bar 'khor te /
analyzed: 'di dag gis bcings 'tsho ba dag ni ro yis 'gro bar 'khor te /
translated: Those who are bound by these wander in the world through the power of karma.

original: phra mo'i dngos po drag gis slar te slar yang 'pho ba'i dga' bas so //üîΩ'ching ba phra mo dang rags pa'i dngos po ste /
analyzed: phra mo'i dngos po drag gis slar te slar yang 'pho ba'i dga' bas so // 'ching ba phra mo dang rags pa'i dngos po ste /
translated: They are again and again reborn by the joy of transmigration.

original: sad pa dang rmi lam dang shin tu gnyid log pa dang bzhi pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: sad pa dang rmi lam dang shin tu gnyid log pa dang bzhi pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The subtle and coarse bonds are the characteristics of the four states of waking, dreaming, deep sleep, and the fourth.

original: dngos po 'di dag btang na mi bzad mchog gi gnas su rab tu 'gro ste /
analyzed: dngos po 'di dag btang na mi bzad mchog gi gnas su rab tu 'gro ste /
translated: If one abandons these things, one goes to the supreme, unbearable state.

original: gang du son na slar yang skye ldan 'khor pa par 'gyur ba min no //
analyzed: gang du son na slar yang skye ldan 'khor pa par 'gyur ba min no //
translated: Where, having gone, one does not again enter the cycle of birth.

original: 'khor ba'i bag chags kyi ma rig pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i bag chags kyi ma rig pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: The ignorance of the habitual tendencies of cyclic existence is certain.

original: da ni yan lag dang bcas zhes pa la sogs pas 'di'i gnyen po rig pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni yan lag dang bcas zhes pa la sogs pas 'di'i gnyen po rig pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, beginning with ‚Äúalong with its branches,‚Äù the knowledge that is its antidote is stated.

original: 'khor ba 'dir 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la rig pa gang yin pa de ni don dam pa de kho na nyid kyi yul la rig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'khor ba 'dir 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la rig pa gang yin pa de ni don dam pa de kho na nyid kyi yul la rig pa ma yin no //
translated: The knowledge that is the convention of the world in this cycle is not the knowledge of the object of ultimate reality.

original: dang por yan lag dang bcas rig byed de yan lag drug dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: dang por yan lag dang bcas rig byed de yan lag drug dang bcas pa'o //
translated: First, there is the knowledge along with its branches, along with its six branches.

original: yan lag drug rnams kyang mdo dang dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa dang / lung ston pa dang / sdeb sbyor dang / nges tshig dang / skar rtsis te 'di dag dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag drug rnams kyang mdo dang dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa dang / lung ston pa dang / sdeb sbyor dang / nges tshig dang / skar rtsis te 'di dag dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The six branches are the sutra, the melody, the prophecy, the meter, the etymology, and the astrology, along with these.

original: zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de yang dran pa'i gzhung dang bcas pa ste dran pa ni shed bu la sogs pa'i gzhung rnams so //
analyzed: de yang dran pa'i gzhung dang bcas pa ste dran pa ni shed bu la sogs pa'i gzhung rnams so //
translated: Moreover, it is along with the texts of memory. Memory is the texts of ≈övetaketu and so on.

original: de rnams dang bcas pa ste yang dag par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams dang bcas pa ste yang dag par ldan pa'o //
translated: He is endowed with those, i.e., he is fully equipped with them.

original: rtog ge ni 'jig rten pa'i dngos po rab tu 'jal ba'i bstan bcos rnams so //
analyzed: rtog ge ni 'jig rten pa'i dngos po rab tu 'jal ba'i bstan bcos rnams so //
translated: Logic is the treatises that thoroughly investigate mundane things.

original: grub pa'i mtha' ni 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub sgrub par byed pa dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la sogs pa rnam par rtog pas bsgom pa'i chos can te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' ni 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub sgrub par byed pa dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la sogs pa rnam par rtog pas bsgom pa'i chos can te /
translated: Philosophy is the Dharma of conceptual meditation, such as the ma·πá·∏çala wheels that accomplish mundane powers.

original: de rnams dang ldan pa zhes pa khyad par du byas pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams dang ldan pa zhes pa khyad par du byas pa'o //
translated: He is endowed with those, i.e., he is distinguished by them.

original: de bzhin du 'jig rten du snyan ngag mkhan po rgyas pa me la sogs pa rnams kyis byas pa'i bstan bcos gzhan yang rig pa min zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig rten du snyan ngag mkhan po rgyas pa me la sogs pa rnams kyis byas pa'i bstan bcos gzhan yang rig pa min zhes pa ste /
translated: Similarly, he is not learned in other treatises composed by the poets of the world, such as VyƒÅsa, Agni, and so on.

original: rgyas pa'i snyan ngag bh'a ra ta dang / me'i snyan ngag bsgom pa'i chos dang / sogs pa'i sgras grog mkhar gyi snyan ngag r'a m'a ya na dang / ma rka na de ya'i snyan ngag sngon rabs kyi chos la sogs pa rnams bzung ste /
analyzed: rgyas pa'i snyan ngag bh'a ra ta dang / me'i snyan ngag bsgom pa'i chos dang / sogs pa'i sgras grog mkhar gyi snyan ngag r'a m'a ya na dang / ma rka na de ya'i snyan ngag sngon rabs kyi chos la sogs pa rnams bzung ste /
translated: The poetry of VyƒÅsa is the MahƒÅbhƒÅrata, the poetry of Agni is the Dharma of meditation, and the poetry of VƒÅlmƒ´ki is the RƒÅmƒÅya·πáa, the Dharma of past lives, and so on.

original: snyan ngag mkhan 'di dag gis byas pa ni rig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: snyan ngag mkhan 'di dag gis byas pa ni rig pa ma yin no //
translated: These poets have not done it.

original: 'o na rig pa gang yin @272b zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: 'o na rig pa gang yin @272b zhe na smras pa /
translated: What then is knowledge?

original: rig pa zhes pa rnam par mi rtog pa nang gi rig pa ste rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: rig pa zhes pa rnam par mi rtog pa nang gi rig pa ste rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid do //
translated: Knowledge is non-conceptual, inner knowledge, emptiness endowed with all aspects.

original: gzhan yang 'gyur med kyang rig pa ste dmigs pa med pa zag pa med pa'i bde ba'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'gyur med kyang rig pa ste dmigs pa med pa zag pa med pa'i bde ba'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: Moreover, knowledge is unchanging, having the nature of non-apprehended, undefiled bliss.

original: rig pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid can rgyu dang 'bras bu gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: rig pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid can rgyu dang 'bras bu gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa ste /
translated: Knowledge has the nature of cause and effect, with cause and effect merging into one.

original: me'i 'od dang sreg par byed pa gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa bzhin no //
analyzed: me'i 'od dang sreg par byed pa gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa bzhin no //
translated: Like the light and burning of a fire merging into one.

original: 'jig rten 'di ni 'das pa dang ltar byung ba'i thub pa chos kyi 'khor lo la gnas pa rnams kyis rab tu gsungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di ni 'das pa dang ltar byung ba'i thub pa chos kyi 'khor lo la gnas pa rnams kyis rab tu gsungs pa nyid do //
translated: This world has been well-proclaimed by the Buddhas of the past and present abiding in the wheel of Dharma.

original: de'i rang bzhin ci zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ci zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: What is its nature? It is said:

original: gang du 'jig rten gsum po mtha' dag ces pa ste bde ba'i skad cig gang las skye ba'i dus su 'jig rten gsum po mtha' dag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang du 'jig rten gsum po mtha' dag ces pa ste bde ba'i skad cig gang las skye ba'i dus su 'jig rten gsum po mtha' dag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Where the three worlds are all, at the time when a moment of bliss arises, the three worlds are all.

original: slar yang gang du thim pa ste /
analyzed: slar yang gang du thim pa ste /
translated: Again, where it dissolves,

original: 'chi ba'i dus su skad cig gang la dngos po'i tshogs pa thim pa'o //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i dus su skad cig gang la dngos po'i tshogs pa thim pa'o //
translated: at the time of death, in the moment when the collection of entities dissolves.

original: 'gyur pa'i skad cig la skad cig de nyid zag pa med pa'i bde ba 'gyur ba med par brjod de /
analyzed: 'gyur pa'i skad cig la skad cig de nyid zag pa med pa'i bde ba 'gyur ba med par brjod de /
translated: In the moment of transformation, that very moment is said to be the unchanging, undefiled bliss.

original: gang las chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i don du sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang / gang du yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'o //
analyzed: gang las chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i don du sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang / gang du yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'o //
translated: From which the Buddha arises for the sake of turning the wheel of Dharma, and where there is the great parinirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: kyi  mi yi bdag po zhes pa ste rig pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: kyi  mi yi bdag po zhes pa ste rig pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: The lord of men, the ascertainment of the knowledge.

original: da ni rnal 'byor zhes pa la sogs pas sngon gyi rnal 'byor goms pa'i stobs gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni rnal 'byor zhes pa la sogs pas sngon gyi rnal 'byor goms pa'i stobs gsungs te /
translated: Now, beginning with ‚Äúyoga,‚Äù he speaks of the power of the yoga of the past:

original: mi'i 'jig rten 'dir gal te rnal 'byor pa rig pa'i rnal 'byor goms par byed pa dag rnal 'byor ma thob rab tu g-yo ba'i yid kyis res 'ga' shi bar gyur pa na /
analyzed: mi'i 'jig rten 'dir gal te rnal 'byor pa rig pa'i rnal 'byor goms par byed pa dag rnal 'byor ma thob rab tu g-yo ba'i yid kyis res 'ga' shi bar gyur pa na /
translated: If in this human world, those who practice the yoga of knowledge, who are not yet accomplished in yoga, should die suddenly with a distracted mind,

original: dpal ldan mi'i 'jig rten du ni rab mchog thub pa'i rigs te /
analyzed: dpal ldan mi'i 'jig rten du ni rab mchog thub pa'i rigs te /
translated: then in the glorious human world, they will be born in the best of families,

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i rigs su rnal 'byor ni stong pa dang snying rje dbyer med pa rnam par dag pa'i de kho na nyid dang rnam par dag pa'i sems so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i rigs su rnal 'byor ni stong pa dang snying rje dbyer med pa rnam par dag pa'i de kho na nyid dang rnam par dag pa'i sems so //
translated: the family of the sages, the family of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas. Yoga is the pure reality of the inseparability of emptiness and compassion, and the pure mind.

original: de dang ldan pa'i phyir rnal 'byor dang ldan pa ste rnal 'byor yongs su rdzogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i phyir rnal 'byor dang ldan pa ste rnal 'byor yongs su rdzogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Endowed with that, they are endowed with yoga, but not fully accomplished in yoga.

original: slar yang sngon gyi goms pa de yis  gun du 'dzin par 'gyur te thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slar yang sngon gyi goms pa de yis  gun du 'dzin par 'gyur te thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Again, by that previous practice, they will be reborn and attain it.

original: ye shes rnal 'byor ni de kho na nyid kyi rnal 'byor te yangs  pa zhes pa ni nyi tshe ba ma yin pa ste rnam pa thams cad pa'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes rnal 'byor ni de kho na nyid kyi rnal 'byor te yangs  pa zhes pa ni nyi tshe ba ma yin pa ste rnam pa thams cad pa'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The yoga of intuition is the yoga of reality. The meaning of ‚Äúvast‚Äù is that it is not limited, but rather is all-inclusive.

original: ye shes thob ste yongs su rdzogs na mi zad mchog gi gnas @273a * //
analyzed: ye shes thob ste yongs su rdzogs na mi zad mchog gi gnas @273a * //
translated: When one has attained intuition and is completely perfected, one goes to the supreme, imperishable state.

original: su rab 'gro zhes pa la gang la zad pa med pa ni mi zad mchog gi gnas so //
analyzed: su rab 'gro zhes pa la gang la zad pa med pa ni mi zad mchog gi gnas so //
translated: In this verse, the imperishable is the supreme state.

original: zhes rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: This is how it is to be construed.

original: de ji ltar gyur pa zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ji ltar gyur pa zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: How is this so? It is said:

original: gang du slar yang skye ba ldan pa ste 'byung ba dang ldan pa min pa de ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi mchog gi gnas so //
analyzed: gang du slar yang skye ba ldan pa ste 'byung ba dang ldan pa min pa de ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi mchog gi gnas so //
translated: Where there is no further birth, no arising, that is the supreme state of all Buddhas.

original: da ni ye shes zhes pa la sogs pas sangs rgyas pa rnams dang lha min rnams dang kla klo rnams kyi ye shes skye ba'i dus gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni ye shes zhes pa la sogs pas sangs rgyas pa rnams dang lha min rnams dang kla klo rnams kyi ye shes skye ba'i dus gsungs te /
translated: Now, beginning with ‚Äúintuition,‚Äù he states the time of the arising of the intuition of the Buddhists, the demigods, and the barbarians.

original: 'dir nges par rnal 'byor goms pa rnam pa gsum ste sangs rgyas pa'i dang lha min gyi dang 'byung po'i'o //
analyzed: 'dir nges par rnal 'byor goms pa rnam pa gsum ste sangs rgyas pa'i dang lha min gyi dang 'byung po'i'o //
translated: Here, there are three kinds of yogic practice: that of the Buddhists, that of the demigods, and that of the spirits.

original: de la sangs rgyas pa'i rnal 'byor ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas pa'i rnal 'byor ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The yogi of the Buddhists is the nature of emptiness and compassion.

original: lha min gyi ni brtags pa'i chos so //
analyzed: lha min gyi ni brtags pa'i chos so //
translated: The yogi of the demigods is the Dharma of investigation.

original: 'byung po'i ni rnam pa gnyis te rtag pa'i ngo bo dang chad pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: 'byung po'i ni rnam pa gnyis te rtag pa'i ngo bo dang chad pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The yogi of the bhutas is of two kinds: the nature of permanence and the nature of annihilation.

original: de bzhin du rnal 'byor de goms pa la dga' ba nyid las de nyid gang la yod pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnal 'byor de goms pa la dga' ba nyid las de nyid gang la yod pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: In the same way, the yogi who delights in the practice of that is the three kinds of yogis.

original: de rnams las nyin mo'i cha la sangs rgyas pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi ye shes skye'o //
analyzed: de rnams las nyin mo'i cha la sangs rgyas pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi ye shes skye'o //
translated: Among them, the wisdom of the yogis of the Buddhists arises in the daytime.

original: mtshan mo'i  cha la lha min gyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: mtshan mo'i  cha la lha min gyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The wisdom of the yogis of the demigods arises in the nighttime.

original: thun mtshams bzhi spangs pa'i dus su 'byung po'i rnal 'byor ba rnams kyi ye shes skye'o //
analyzed: thun mtshams bzhi spangs pa'i dus su 'byung po'i rnal 'byor ba rnams kyi ye shes skye'o //
translated: The wisdom of the yogis of the bhutas arises at the time of abandoning the four periods.

original: 'dir dus kyi cha ni ye shes skye ste rgyal ba rnams kyi nyi ma nyin mo'i dus su mtshan mo phyed dang mtshan mo'i mthar /
analyzed: 'dir dus kyi cha ni ye shes skye ste rgyal ba rnams kyi nyi ma nyin mo'i dus su mtshan mo phyed dang mtshan mo'i mthar /
translated: Here, the wisdom arises in the part of time. The sun of the victors is the daytime, and the end of the night is the end of the night.

original: lha min rnams kyi zla ba mtshan mo'i dus su nyi ma phyed dang nyin mo dag gi mjug tu'o //üîΩ'byung po rnams kyi yang ma brjod pa nyid las thun mtshams spangs pa'i dus su'o //
analyzed: lha min rnams kyi zla ba mtshan mo'i dus su nyi ma phyed dang nyin mo dag gi mjug tu'o // 'byung po rnams kyi yang ma brjod pa nyid las thun mtshams spangs pa'i dus su'o //
translated: For the demigods, the moon is at midnight and the sun at the end of the day.üîΩFor the bhutas, the sun is at the end of the day, but not at midnight.

original: 'dir mtshan mo phyed dam /
analyzed: 'dir mtshan mo phyed dam /
translated: Here, at midnight

original: snga dro'i thun mtshams la sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi ye shes lhag par gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snga dro'i thun mtshams la sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi ye shes lhag par gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: or at the end of the morning period, the wisdom of the Buddhists is predominant.

original: nyi ma phyed dam nub par gyur pa'i thun mtshams la lha min rnams kyi ye shes lhag par gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyi ma phyed dam nub par gyur pa'i thun mtshams la lha min rnams kyi ye shes lhag par gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: At noon or at the end of the day, the wisdom of the demigods is predominant.

original: gzhan thun bzhi'i thun mtshams la 'byung po rnams kyi ste nyin mo'i  chal rtag pa'i ye shes lhag par gnas shing mtshan mo'i cha la chad pa'i ye shes lhag par gnas so //
analyzed: gzhan thun bzhi'i thun mtshams la 'byung po rnams kyi ste nyin mo'i  chal rtag pa'i ye shes lhag par gnas shing mtshan mo'i cha la chad pa'i ye shes lhag par gnas so //
translated: For the bhutas, the wisdom of the four periods is predominant during the day, and the wisdom of the four periods is predominant at night.

original: sangs rgyas pa dang lha min 'di dag gi drangs bzhin du sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi yang dag ye shes su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa dang lha min 'di dag gi drangs bzhin du sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi yang dag ye shes su 'gyur ro //
translated: For the Buddhists and demigods, the wisdom of the Buddhists is predominant.

original: de'i chos dang 'gal ba rnams ni lha min rnams kyir  'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i chos dang 'gal ba rnams ni lha min rnams kyir  'gyur ro //
translated: Those which are contrary to his Dharma are the Asuras.

original: yang dag ye shes ni nyin mo'i @273b snang ba bzhin du thams cad mthong ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag ye shes ni nyin mo'i @273b snang ba bzhin du thams cad mthong ba'o //
translated: The knowledge of the truth is like the light of day, seeing everything.

original: rnam nyams ye shes ni mtshan mo'i snang ba bzhin sems can rnams kyi 'chi ba dang 'tsho ba cung zad mthong pa'o //
analyzed: rnam nyams ye shes ni mtshan mo'i snang ba bzhin sems can rnams kyi 'chi ba dang 'tsho ba cung zad mthong pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the destruction of the truth is like the light of night, seeing a little of the death and life of beings.

original: ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How is it known?

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: chos bsten pa las so zhes pa ste /
analyzed: chos bsten pa las so zhes pa ste /
translated: From the practice of Dharma.üîΩHere, the words of the knowledge of the truth are in the ordinary Sanskrit language, while the words of the knowledge of the destruction of the truth are in the ordinary language.

original: 'dir yang dag ye shes rnam nyams dag la tshig ni legs sbyar tha mal dag tu rab tu 'gyur ba ste zhes pa ni yang dag ye shes skyes pa rnams kyis legs par sbyar ba'i ngag sgra thams cad kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: 'dir yang dag ye shes rnam nyams dag la tshig ni legs sbyar tha mal dag tu rab tu 'gyur ba ste zhes pa ni yang dag ye shes skyes pa rnams kyis legs par sbyar ba'i ngag sgra thams cad kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: For those in whom the knowledge of the truth has arisen, the words are in all the languages of the nature of sound in the Sanskrit language.

original: rnam nyams ye shes skyes pa rnams kyi tha mal gyi dag tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam nyams ye shes skyes pa rnams kyi tha mal gyi dag tu 'gyur te /
translated: For those in whom the knowledge of the destruction of the truth has arisen, they become ordinary words.

original: ston pa byed pa po rnams kyi yul gcig gi skad gcig gi skad kyi khyad par gyis so //
analyzed: ston pa byed pa po rnams kyi yul gcig gi skad gcig gi skad kyi khyad par gyis so //
