translated: Due to the difference in the languages of one country of the teachers.

original: sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi ye shes ni sems can thams cad la snying rje'i bdag nyid can zhi ba'i las ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi ye shes ni sems can thams cad la snying rje'i bdag nyid can zhi ba'i las ston par byed pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the Buddhists is the display of the action of peace, which is the nature of compassion for all sentient beings.

original: lha min rnams kyi ye shes ni sha bza' ba'i slad du dud 'gro'i sems can la gnod pa byed pa drang po'i las ston par byed pa po'o //
analyzed: lha min rnams kyi ye shes ni sha bza' ba'i slad du dud 'gro'i sems can la gnod pa byed pa drang po'i las ston par byed pa po'o //
translated: The knowledge of the demigods is the display of the action of honesty, which is the harm to animal beings for the sake of eating meat.

original: srid pa gsum gyi gnas su sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi ye shes ni skyes bu nyid kyi las ston par byed do //
analyzed: srid pa gsum gyi gnas su sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi ye shes ni skyes bu nyid kyi las ston par byed do //
translated: In the three worlds, the knowledge of the Buddhists is the display of the action of manhood.

original: lha min rnams kyi ye shes ni sa la tha mal gyi las ston par byed do //
analyzed: lha min rnams kyi ye shes ni sa la tha mal gyi las ston par byed do //
translated: The knowledge of the demigods is the display of the action of the ordinary man on the earth.

original: 'byung po rnams kyi ni sa la rnam par 'dres pa'i las ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'byung po rnams kyi ni sa la rnam par 'dres pa'i las ston par byed do //
translated: That of the bh≈´tas is the display of the action of the mixture on the earth.

original: ye shes ston par byed pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes ston par byed pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the determination of the display of knowledge.

original: da ni nyi ma gung zhes pa la sogs pas sangs rgyas pa dang lha min dag gi za ba'i dus gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni nyi ma gung zhes pa la sogs pas sangs rgyas pa dang lha min dag gi za ba'i dus gsungs te /
translated: Now, beginning with ‚Äúat midday,‚Äù he speaks of the time of eating of the Buddhists and demigods.

original: 'dir nyin zhag so so la nyi ma gung nas brtsams nas mtshan mo phyed kyi bar du nyin mo'i dus so //
analyzed: 'dir nyin zhag so so la nyi ma gung nas brtsams nas mtshan mo phyed kyi bar du nyin mo'i dus so //
translated: Here, from noon of each day until midnight is the daytime.

original: mtshan mo phyed nas brtsams nas nyi ma gung gi mthar thug pa ni mtshan mo'i dus so //
analyzed: mtshan mo phyed nas brtsams nas nyi ma gung gi mthar thug pa ni mtshan mo'i dus so //
translated: From midnight until noon is the nighttime.

original: nyin mo dang mtshan mo'i dus de las rang rang gi dus kyi phyed phyi ma ni grangs bzhin du sangs rgyas pa dang / kla klo de dag gi dka' thub pa rnams kyi za ba'i dus te khyim pa rnams kyi ni ma yin no zhes pa ste nges pa'o //
analyzed: nyin mo dang mtshan mo'i dus de las rang rang gi dus kyi phyed phyi ma ni grangs bzhin du sangs rgyas pa dang / kla klo de dag gi dka' thub pa rnams kyi za ba'i dus te khyim pa rnams kyi ni ma yin no zhes pa ste nges pa'o //
translated: In the latter half of the day and night, respectively, is the time for ascetics to eat, not householders.

original: sangs rgyas pa dang lha min dag gi bza' ba dang btung ba yang grangs bzhin du sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi zan khyad par du 'phags pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa dang lha min dag gi bza' ba dang btung ba yang grangs bzhin du sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi zan khyad par du 'phags pa ste /
translated: The food and drink of Buddhists and asuras is, respectively, the superior food of Buddhists,

original: kla klo rnams kyi ba lang gi sha dang bcas pa'o //üîΩbtung ba ni grangs @274a * //
analyzed: kla klo rnams kyi ba lang gi sha dang bcas pa'o // btung ba ni grangs @274a * //
translated: and the food of barbarians is cow meat.

original: bzhin du sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi rnam mang bcud ster zhim pa ste /
analyzed: bzhin du sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi rnam mang bcud ster zhim pa ste /
translated: The drink of Buddhists is, respectively, the many kinds of delicious nutritious drinks of Buddhists,üîΩand the drink of barbarians is alcohol.

original: kla klo rnams kyi btung ba ni bya gag la sogs pa'i sgo nga'i khu ba'o //
analyzed: kla klo rnams kyi btung ba ni bya gag la sogs pa'i sgo nga'i khu ba'o //
translated: The barbarians drink the juice of eggs of fowl and so on.

original: bgo ba ni grangs bzhin du sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi gos dmar po ste /
analyzed: bgo ba ni grangs bzhin du sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi gos dmar po ste /
translated: The clothing is red for the Buddhists,

original: kla klo rnams kyi ni dkar po'o //
analyzed: kla klo rnams kyi ni dkar po'o //
translated: and white for the barbarians.

original: dka' thub pa rnams kyi ste khyim pa rnams kyi ni nges pa med do //
analyzed: dka' thub pa rnams kyi ste khyim pa rnams kyi ni nges pa med do //
translated: The ascetics wear it, but not the householders.

original: de bzhin du shi ba'i mthar gnas ni grangs bzhin du nyi ma zla ba'i bgrod pa bzhin du zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du shi ba'i mthar gnas ni grangs bzhin du nyi ma zla ba'i bgrod pa bzhin du zhes pa ste /
translated: Similarly, the final abode of the dead is like the course of the sun and moon, respectively.

original: nyi ma steng du bgrod cing zla ba 'og tu bgrod do //
analyzed: nyi ma steng du bgrod cing zla ba 'og tu bgrod do //
translated: The sun moves above, and the moon moves below.

original: de dag gi bgrod pa bzhin du mtho ris kyi gnas nyi ma'i bgrod pa ni sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: de dag gi bgrod pa bzhin du mtho ris kyi gnas nyi ma'i bgrod pa ni sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi ste /
translated: Like their courses, the abode of heaven is the course of the sun for the Buddhists,

original: zla ba'i bgrod pa bzhin sa 'og gi gnas ni lha min rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: zla ba'i bgrod pa bzhin sa 'og gi gnas ni lha min rnams kyi'o //
translated: and the abode below the earth is the course of the moon for the demigods.

original: de bzhin du rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi dbang mdor bstan pa las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi dbang mdor bstan pa las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: Similarly, in the root tantra, the Concise Teaching on Initiations, the Lord said:

original: lus can thams cad shi ba na //
analyzed: lus can thams cad shi ba na //
translated: When all embodied beings die,

original: zla ba bdud rtsi 'og tu 'gro //
analyzed: zla ba bdud rtsi 'og tu 'gro //
translated: the nectar moon moves below.

original: steng du nyi ma rdul sgra gcan //
analyzed: steng du nyi ma rdul sgra gcan //
translated: Above, the sun, the moon, and RƒÅhu.

original: rnam shes dngos po'i mtshan nyid do //üîΩde bzhin du chos ni grangs bzhin du sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi 'tshe  ba med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam shes dngos po'i mtshan nyid do // de bzhin du chos ni grangs bzhin du sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi 'tshe  ba med pa'o //
translated: These are the characteristics of the elements.

original: kla klo rnams kyi ni 'tshe ba ste yang yig las 'byung po rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: kla klo rnams kyi ni 'tshe ba ste yang yig las 'byung po rnams kyi'o //
translated: Similarly, the Dharma is non-violence for the Buddhists, violence for the barbarians, and for the beings, as stated by the word ‚Äúalso.‚Äù

original: bla ma'i nges pa'i dbang gis bsgom pa'i dus dang 'dod pa'i lha la bstod pa'i dus su grangs bzhin du sangs rgyas pa rnams la rdo rje'i gdan bsngags shing kla klo rnams la lha min gyi gdan bsngags so //
analyzed: bla ma'i nges pa'i dbang gis bsgom pa'i dus dang 'dod pa'i lha la bstod pa'i dus su grangs bzhin du sangs rgyas pa rnams la rdo rje'i gdan bsngags shing kla klo rnams la lha min gyi gdan bsngags so //
translated: By the power of the guru‚Äôs instruction, at the time of meditation and at the time of praising the chosen deity, the vajra seat is praised for the Buddhists and the asura seat is praised for the barbarians.

original: yang yig las gzhan ni thun mong ba ste de ni mi sgrub cing mi 'gog go //
analyzed: yang yig las gzhan ni thun mong ba ste de ni mi sgrub cing mi 'gog go //
translated: The other, stated by the word ‚Äúalso,‚Äù is common, and that is neither established nor refuted.

original: 'dir lha min gyi gdan ni sa'i ngos la pus mo g-yon gyi steng du pus mo g-yas brkyang zhing rkang pa g-yon gyi steng du rkang pa g-yas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir lha min gyi gdan ni sa'i ngos la pus mo g-yon gyi steng du pus mo g-yas brkyang zhing rkang pa g-yon gyi steng du rkang pa g-yas pa'o //
translated: Here, the asura seat is the left knee on the ground, with the right knee extended, and the right foot on top of the left foot.

original: yang yig las 'og tu ste rkang pa g-yas pa'i steng du'o //
analyzed: yang yig las 'og tu ste rkang pa g-yas pa'i steng du'o //
translated: By the word ‚Äúalso,‚Äù it is below, on top of the right foot.

original: rkang pa'i mthil du yang yang yig las rgyab tu  dpyi bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: rkang pa'i mthil du yang yang yig las rgyab tu  dpyi bzhag pa'o //
translated: And on the soles of the feet, from the syllable ya·πÉ, the buttocks.

original: rdo rje'i gdan la sogs pa ni 'chad par 'gyur ba las brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i gdan la sogs pa ni 'chad par 'gyur ba las brjod par bya'o //
translated: The vajra seat, etc., will be described in the following verses.

original: sangs rgyas pa dang lha min gyi bya ba nges pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa dang lha min gyi bya ba nges pa'o //
translated: The activities of the Buddhists and the demigods are determined.

original: 'byung po rnams kyi las 'dren mar sngar gsungs pa de yang 'dir tshigs su bcad pas gsal par gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'byung po rnams kyi las 'dren mar sngar gsungs pa de yang 'dir tshigs su bcad pas gsal par gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The mixed activities of the bh≈´tas, previously mentioned, are clarified here in verse:

original: 'byung po rnams kyi las ni 'dren mar rab tu 'gyur te tshig kyang 'dres pa sha za dag gi'o //
analyzed: 'byung po rnams kyi las ni 'dren mar rab tu 'gyur te tshig kyang 'dres pa sha za dag gi'o //
translated: The activities of the bh≈´tas are thoroughly mixed, and the words are mixed, of the pi≈õƒÅcas.

original: chos ni 'tshe med 'tshe ldan bla ma'i nges pa'i dbang gi srog gcod la sogs skyon dag la //
analyzed: chos ni 'tshe med 'tshe ldan bla ma'i nges pa'i dbang gi srog gcod la sogs skyon dag la //
translated: The Dharma is nonviolence and violence, of the guru, by the power of the vow, killing, etc.,

original: mchod sbyin la sogs don du rab tu 'jug sogs pa'i sgras g-yul gyi don du 'tsho  ba la rab @274b tu 'jug go //
analyzed: mchod sbyin la sogs don du rab tu 'jug sogs pa'i sgras g-yul gyi don du 'tsho  ba la rab @274b tu 'jug go //
translated: are faults. For the sake of sacrifice, etc., one engages in battle, etc. The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes engaging in livelihood for the sake of battle.

original: dka' thub kyi 'bras bu'i don du ldog pa ste /
analyzed: dka' thub kyi 'bras bu'i don du ldog pa ste /
translated: For the sake of the fruit of asceticism, one turns away.

original: mi 'tshe ba la rab tu 'jug par 'gyur te mi yi bdag po res 'ga' dag ni ldog pa 'am zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'tshe ba la rab tu 'jug par 'gyur te mi yi bdag po res 'ga' dag ni ldog pa 'am zhes pa'o //
translated: One should enter into non-violence, O Lord of Men, sometimes reversing.

original: bza' ba btung ba dag kyang 'dres pa nyi zla'i bgrod pa dag las lam ni 'dren ma gzhan du'o zhes pa ni /
analyzed: bza' ba btung ba dag kyang 'dres pa nyi zla'i bgrod pa dag las lam ni 'dren ma gzhan du'o zhes pa ni /
translated: Food and drink are mixed, the path from the movement of the sun and moon is mixed elsewhere.

original: 'byung po rnams kyi lam ni thams cad kun du 'dres par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'byung po rnams kyi lam ni thams cad kun du 'dres par rig par bya'o //
translated: The path of all beings should be known as completely mixed.

original: 'byung po rnams kyi bya ba'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung po rnams kyi bya ba'i nges pa'o //
translated: The determination of the activities of beings.

original: da ni 'od zer zhes pa la sogs pas lam brjod par 'dod pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni 'od zer zhes pa la sogs pas lam brjod par 'dod pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, beginning with light rays, he declares the desire to speak of the path.

original: 'dir lam ni rnam pa gsum ste 'od zer gyi lam dang du ba'i lam dang rnam par 'dres pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: 'dir lam ni rnam pa gsum ste 'od zer gyi lam dang du ba'i lam dang rnam par 'dres pa'i lam mo //
translated: Here, the path is threefold: the path of light rays, the path of smoke, and the path of mixture.

original: 'di dag las 'od zer lam ni nyi ma'i snang ba dkar po nyin mo bgrod pa byang ste nyin mo 'phel ba'i mtshan nyid dang lo phyed ni phyi rol du ste /
analyzed: 'di dag las 'od zer lam ni nyi ma'i snang ba dkar po nyin mo bgrod pa byang ste nyin mo 'phel ba'i mtshan nyid dang lo phyed ni phyi rol du ste /
translated: Of these, the path of light rays is the white radiance of the sun, the northern movement, the characteristic of the increase of day, and the six months externally.

original: nang du chu srin la sogs pa dus sbyor drug gi bdag nyid can te /
analyzed: nang du chu srin la sogs pa dus sbyor drug gi bdag nyid can te /
translated: Internally, it is the six signs beginning with Capricorn.

original: shar ba nas nub pa zhes bya ba'i ming can no //
analyzed: shar ba nas nub pa zhes bya ba'i ming can no //
translated: It is called ‚Äúarising‚Äù and ‚Äúceasing.‚ÄùüîΩ

original: du ba'i lam ni zla ba'i snang ba mtshan mo dag dang dkar min bgrod pa 'di ni lho ste /
analyzed: du ba'i lam ni zla ba'i snang ba mtshan mo dag dang dkar min bgrod pa 'di ni lho ste /
translated: The path of smoke is the path of the moon, the path of the white fortnight, and the southern course.

original: du ba'i lam dag la ka rka ta la sogs pa lhor bgrod pa'i zla ba drug ste /
analyzed: du ba'i lam dag la ka rka ta la sogs pa lhor bgrod pa'i zla ba drug ste /
translated: On the path of smoke, the six months of the southern course of the moon beginning with Karka·π≠aka are the path of smoke.

original: gang du mtshan mo 'phel ba de lhor bgrod pa'o //
analyzed: gang du mtshan mo 'phel ba de lhor bgrod pa'o //
translated: Where the night increases, that is the southern course.

original: nub par gyur pa nas shar ba'i bar ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: nub par gyur pa nas shar ba'i bar ni nges pa'o //
translated: From the setting to the rising is the northern course.

original: 'dir 'od zer lha rnams mtho ris su ste mtsho ris su 'gro ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: 'dir 'od zer lha rnams mtho ris su ste mtsho ris su 'gro ba'i lam mo //
translated: Here, the light rays go to the gods in the higher realms, the path of the white fortnight.

original: dkar min bgrod pa lha min rnams kyi klu'i 'jig rten du 'gro ba'i du ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: dkar min bgrod pa lha min rnams kyi klu'i 'jig rten du 'gro ba'i du ba'i lam mo //
translated: The path of the smoke is the path of the asuras, the path of the dark fortnight, the path of the nƒÅgas.

original: kun du 'dres pa nyin mo dang mtshan mo'i chos can ni mi yi 'jig rten du 'gro ba la ste /
analyzed: kun du 'dres pa nyin mo dang mtshan mo'i chos can ni mi yi 'jig rten du 'gro ba la ste /
translated: The mixed path of day and night is the path of humans.

original: yi dags dang dud 'gro dang mi rnams bskyed pa la rab tu gsal bar byas so zhes pa ni lam gyi nges pa ste /
analyzed: yi dags dang dud 'gro dang mi rnams bskyed pa la rab tu gsal bar byas so zhes pa ni lam gyi nges pa ste /
translated: The path of the gods, the path of the asuras, and the path of humans are clearly explained.üîΩThis is the certainty of the path.

original: skye ba snga ma'i bag chags kyis bskyed pa'i snying stobs dang mun pa dang rdul gyi yon tan gyi rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: skye ba snga ma'i bag chags kyis bskyed pa'i snying stobs dang mun pa dang rdul gyi yon tan gyi rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: By the nature of the qualities of sattva, tamas, and rajas, which are produced by the latent tendencies of previous births.

original: da ni gang zhig gang gi dbus su zhes pa la sogs pas sangs rgyas pa'i nyan thos dang lha min dang 'byung po'i las la dga' ba'i sems can rnams kyi bag chags 'dzin pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni gang zhig gang gi dbus su zhes pa la sogs pas sangs rgyas pa'i nyan thos dang lha min dang 'byung po'i las la dga' ba'i sems can rnams kyi bag chags 'dzin pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, beginning with ‚ÄúIf someone enters the middle of which,‚Äù he explains the latent tendencies of beings who delight in the actions of Buddhists, ≈õrƒÅvakas, asuras, and bh≈´tas.

original: 'khor ba 'dir skye ba'i las kyi bag chags kyi stobs kyis lha dang lha min dang 'byung po'i bya ba la rjes su chags pa gang zhig gang gi dbus su rab tu zhugs par gyur te /
analyzed: 'khor ba 'dir skye ba'i las kyi bag chags kyi stobs kyis lha dang lha min dang 'byung po'i bya ba la rjes su chags pa gang zhig gang gi dbus su rab tu zhugs par gyur te /
translated: By the power of the latent tendencies of karma for birth in this sa·πÉsƒÅra, if someone who delights in the activities of gods, asuras, and bh≈´tas enters the middle of which,

original: brtul zhugs nges pa la dga' las kyi zhags pas des bcings pa //
analyzed: brtul zhugs nges pa la dga' las kyi zhags pas des bcings pa //
translated: he is bound by the noose of karma, delighting in the certainty of observances.

original: zhes pa chos de'i bya ba rnams kyis bcings pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa chos de'i bya ba rnams kyis bcings pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy the activities of that dharma‚Äù means he is bound by the activities of that dharma.

original: de yi dbus su dang rang bsam pas mi bdag ni bod pa ste /
analyzed: de yi dbus su dang rang bsam pas mi bdag ni bod pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIn the middle of that‚Äù means the king is deceived by his own thoughts.

original: de'i rigs @275a * //
analyzed: de'i rigs @275a * //
translated: His lineage is

original: te lha dang lha min dang 'byung po'i rigs su de'i 'dzin pa dag gis zhes pa ni de'i dngos po'i 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: te lha dang lha min dang 'byung po'i rigs su de'i 'dzin pa dag gis zhes pa ni de'i dngos po'i 'dzin pa ste /
translated: By the grasping of that, i.e., by the grasping of the reality of that,

original: de yis lha dang lha min dang 'byung po'i rigs su skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yis lha dang lha min dang 'byung po'i rigs su skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: one is born in the class of gods, titans, and elemental spirits.

original: snying stobs dang mun pa dang rdul gyi ngar 'dzin gyis te sngar brjod pa'i cho gas so //
analyzed: snying stobs dang mun pa dang rdul gyi ngar 'dzin gyis te sngar brjod pa'i cho gas so //
translated: By the grasping of sattva, rajas, and tamas, in the manner previously described.

original: ji srid sems kyi rang bzhin dag ni rnam gsum srid pa'i dbang gis zhes pa ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i srid pa'i bag chags kyi dbang gis te /
analyzed: ji srid sems kyi rang bzhin dag ni rnam gsum srid pa'i dbang gis zhes pa ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i srid pa'i bag chags kyi dbang gis te /
translated: As long as the three natures of the mind exist, by the power of existence, i.e., by the power of the residual impressions of the existence of the desire, form, and formless realms,

original: tshor ba bde ba dang sdug bsngal 'khor ba par gyur pa de srid du 'khor ba sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid du sems kyang 'khyam ste /
analyzed: tshor ba bde ba dang sdug bsngal 'khor ba par gyur pa de srid du 'khor ba sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid du sems kyang 'khyam ste /
translated: the mind wanders in the cycle of suffering, characterized by the experience of pleasure and pain.

original: mi yi bdag po mtho ris mi yul dag dang 'og tu yang zhes pa lha dang mi dang dmyal ba la sogs pa 'gro ba drug po rnams su kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa 'khyam mo zhes pa ste bag chags 'dzin pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: mi yi bdag po mtho ris mi yul dag dang 'og tu yang zhes pa lha dang mi dang dmyal ba la sogs pa 'gro ba drug po rnams su kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa 'khyam mo zhes pa ste bag chags 'dzin pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: The lord of men wanders in the six realms, in the heavens, the human world, and below, that is, in the gods, humans, hell beings, and so on.

original: de'i phyir bag chags rnam par gsum las 'das pa ni 'khor ba'i pha rol mthar son pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir bag chags rnam par gsum las 'das pa ni 'khor ba'i pha rol mthar son pa /
translated: Therefore, the one who has gone beyond the three traces has gone to the end of the other shore of sa·πÉsƒÅra,

original: bya ba byas pa skam  sar gnas pa /
analyzed: bya ba byas pa skam  sar gnas pa /
translated: has done what had to be done, and abides on dry land.

original: ye shes kyi sku bcom ldan 'das yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas lha dang lha ma yin dang klu la sogs pa rnams kyis zhabs kyi padma la phyag byas pa dus kyi 'khor lo'o zhes pa ni bag chags spangs pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi sku bcom ldan 'das yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas lha dang lha ma yin dang klu la sogs pa rnams kyis zhabs kyi padma la phyag byas pa dus kyi 'khor lo'o zhes pa ni bag chags spangs pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: The one who has abandoned the traces is the BhagavƒÅn, the perfect, complete Buddha, the body of wisdom, whose lotus feet are bowed to by gods, demigods, nƒÅgas, and so on, the KƒÅlacakra.

original: da ni ka sogs zhes pa la sogs pas mngal du gsal byed dang dbyangs kyang skye bar 'gyur ba ji lta ba de bzhin du 'chi ba'i mtshan nyid gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni ka sogs zhes pa la sogs pas mngal du gsal byed dang dbyangs kyang skye bar 'gyur ba ji lta ba de bzhin du 'chi ba'i mtshan nyid gsungs te /
translated: Now, beginning with ‚Äúthe ka, etc.,‚Äù he explains the characteristics of death, just as the vowels and consonants are born in the womb.

original: 'dir mngal 'dzin pa'i dus su rdul ni gsal byed sum cu'i bdag nyid dang khu ba ni dbyangs sum cu'i bdag nyid de 'di dag kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pas byin gyis brlabs pa ni yang dag par sbyor ro ;
analyzed: 'dir mngal 'dzin pa'i dus su rdul ni gsal byed sum cu'i bdag nyid dang khu ba ni dbyangs sum cu'i bdag nyid de 'di dag kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pas byin gyis brlabs pa ni yang dag par sbyor ro ;
translated: Here, at the time of conception, the semen is the nature of the thirty consonants and the blood is the nature of the thirty vowels. These are empowered by the ƒÅlaya consciousness and are the correct union.

original: /'dir mngal du skye ba'i phyogs dang po la ka yig la sogs pa'i gsal byed sum cu po rnams dbyangs thung  ngus byin gyis brlabs pa dang / phyogs phyi ma la dbyangs ring pos byin gyis brlabs pa ste gsal byed kyi phyogs gnyis po 'di ni 'chi ba la rab tu gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: /'dir mngal du skye ba'i phyogs dang po la ka yig la sogs pa'i gsal byed sum cu po rnams dbyangs thung  ngus byin gyis brlabs pa dang / phyogs phyi ma la dbyangs ring pos byin gyis brlabs pa ste gsal byed kyi phyogs gnyis po 'di ni 'chi ba la rab tu gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, in the first part of the womb, the thirty consonants beginning with ka are empowered by the short vowels, and in the latter part, they are empowered by the long vowels. These two parts of the consonants become clear at the time of death.

original: de bzhin du dkar po'i phyogs la khu ba'i nam mkha'i khams rdul la rab tu 'jug ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du dkar po'i phyogs la khu ba'i nam mkha'i khams rdul la rab tu 'jug ste /
translated: Similarly, in the bright fortnight, the space element of the semen enters the blood.

original: nag po'i phyogs la sa'i khams rab tu 'jug go //
analyzed: nag po'i phyogs la sa'i khams rab tu 'jug go //
translated: In the dark fortnight, the earth element enters.

original: de bzhin du 'byung ba dang mi 'byung ba dag la rdul gyi sa dang nam mkha'i khams dag khu ba'i khams la rab tu 'jug go //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'byung ba dang mi 'byung ba dag la rdul gyi sa dang nam mkha'i khams dag khu ba'i khams la rab tu 'jug go //
translated: In the same way, in the case of the arising and non-arising of the elements, the earth and space elements enter into the water element.

original: de bzhin du zla ba gnyis pa'i phyogs @275b dang po la ai yig gis byin gyis brlabs pa'i gsal byed rnams te rdul rlung gi khams rab tu 'jug go //
analyzed: de bzhin du zla ba gnyis pa'i phyogs @275b dang po la ai yig gis byin gyis brlabs pa'i gsal byed rnams te rdul rlung gi khams rab tu 'jug go //
translated: In the same way, in the first part of the second month, the consonants blessed by the vowel i enter, the wind element being the dust.

original: phyogs phyi ma la au yig gis byin gyis brlabs pa rnams te chu'i khams 'jug go //
analyzed: phyogs phyi ma la au yig gis byin gyis brlabs pa rnams te chu'i khams 'jug go //
translated: In the second part, the consonants blessed by the vowel u enter, the water element entering.

original: gsum pa'i phyogs dang po la me'i khams 'jug pa'i slad du ri yig gis byin gyis brlabs pa rnams so //
analyzed: gsum pa'i phyogs dang po la me'i khams 'jug pa'i slad du ri yig gis byin gyis brlabs pa rnams so //
translated: In the first part of the third month, the consonants blessed by the vowel ri enter, the fire element entering.

original: phyogs phyi ma la me'i khams 'jug pa'i slad du r'i yig gis byin gyis brlabs pa rnams so //
analyzed: phyogs phyi ma la me'i khams 'jug pa'i slad du r'i yig gis byin gyis brlabs pa rnams so //
translated: In the second part, the consonants blessed by the vowel ru enter, the fire element entering.

original: zla ba bzhi pa'i phyogs dang po la chu'i khams 'jug pa'i slad du au yig gis byin gyis brlabs pa rnams so //
analyzed: zla ba bzhi pa'i phyogs dang po la chu'i khams 'jug pa'i slad du au yig gis byin gyis brlabs pa rnams so //
translated: In the first part of the fourth month, the consonants blessed by the vowel u enter, the water element entering.

original: phyogs phyi ma la rlung gi khams 'jug pa'i slad du a'i yig gis byin gyis brlabs pa rnams so //üîΩzla ba lnga pa'i phyogs dang po la sa'i khams 'jug pa'i slad du li yig gis byin gyis brlabs pa rnams so //
analyzed: phyogs phyi ma la rlung gi khams 'jug pa'i slad du a'i yig gis byin gyis brlabs pa rnams so // zla ba lnga pa'i phyogs dang po la sa'i khams 'jug pa'i slad du li yig gis byin gyis brlabs pa rnams so //
translated: The vowels are blessed by the long ƒÅ for the purpose of the wind element entering in the latter half of the month.üîΩThe vowels are blessed by the long ƒ´ for the purpose of the earth element entering in the first half of the fifth month.

original: phyogs phyi ma la nam mkha'i khams 'jug pa'i slad du a'a yig ring pos byin gyis brlabs pa rnams te /
analyzed: phyogs phyi ma la nam mkha'i khams 'jug pa'i slad du a'a yig ring pos byin gyis brlabs pa rnams te /
translated: The vowels are blessed by the long ƒÅ for the purpose of the space element entering in the latter half of the month.

original: skyed pa dang sdud pa'i dbye bas nam mkha' la sogs pa dang sa la sogs pa khu ba dang rdul dag phan tshun du 'jug go //
analyzed: skyed pa dang sdud pa'i dbye bas nam mkha' la sogs pa dang sa la sogs pa khu ba dang rdul dag phan tshun du 'jug go //
translated: Thus, by the division of creation and dissolution, space and so on and earth and so on enter into the semen and blood, respectively.

original: de nas dbang po dang las kyi dbang po byin gyis brlabs pa'i slad du yon tan dang 'phel ba dang ha la sogs pa thung ngu dang ring po rnams gsal byed  rnams la 'jug par byed de /üîΩzla ba drug pa'i phyogs dang po'i phyed la aa /
analyzed: de nas dbang po dang las kyi dbang po byin gyis brlabs pa'i slad du yon tan dang 'phel ba dang ha la sogs pa thung ngu dang ring po rnams gsal byed  rnams la 'jug par byed de / zla ba drug pa'i phyogs dang po'i phyed la aa /
translated: Then, for the purpose of blessing the faculties and the faculties of action, the short and long sounds such as ha and so on and the qualities and increases enter into the consonants.üîΩThe short a is in the first half of the first half of the sixth month.

original: phyogs dang po'i phyed phyi ma la ha /
analyzed: phyogs dang po'i phyed phyi ma la ha /
translated: The ha is in the latter half of the first half of the month.

original: phyogs phyi ma'i phyed la a'a la /
analyzed: phyogs phyi ma'i phyed la a'a la /
translated: In the second half of the latter, the letter A.

original: phyogs phyi ma'i phyed phyi ma la l'a /
analyzed: phyogs phyi ma'i phyed phyi ma la l'a /
translated: In the second half of the latter, the letter La.

original: de bzhin du bdun pa la ae ya aoo w'a //
analyzed: de bzhin du bdun pa la ae ya aoo w'a //
translated: In the same way, in the seventh, the letters E, Ya, O, Va.

original: brgyad pa la aa ra ra a'a ra r'a /
analyzed: brgyad pa la aa ra ra a'a ra r'a /
translated: In the eighth, the letters A, Ra, Ra, A, Ra, Ra.

original: dgu pa la ao wa aee y'a /
analyzed: dgu pa la ao wa aee y'a /
translated: In the ninth, the letters O, Va, Ai, Ya.

original: bcu pa la aa la la a'a h'a zhes pa gsal byed sum cu po rnams la 'jug go //
analyzed: bcu pa la aa la la a'a h'a zhes pa gsal byed sum cu po rnams la 'jug go //
translated: In the tenth, the letters A, La, La, A, Ha. Thus, the thirty consonants are applied.

original: mngal gyi zla ba'i rjes la zla ba bcus phun po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa rnams 'grub bo //
analyzed: mngal gyi zla ba'i rjes la zla ba bcus phun po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa rnams 'grub bo //
translated: After the months in the womb, the ten months are completed, and the aggregates, elements, sense bases, and so forth are established.

original: khu ba dang rdul yang dag par sbyor bas phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa rnams spro ste skyed pa dang sdud pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: khu ba dang rdul yang dag par sbyor bas phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa rnams spro ste skyed pa dang sdud pa'i rim pas so //
translated: From the perfect union of semen and blood, the aggregates, elements, sense bases, and so forth expand, that is, are produced, through the process of expansion and contraction.

original: de bzhin du zla ba bcu gcig pa la thig les byin gyis brlabs pa sum cu dang / zla ba bcu gnyis pa la rnam par bcad pas byin gyis brlabs pa rnams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du zla ba bcu gcig pa la thig les byin gyis brlabs pa sum cu dang / zla ba bcu gnyis pa la rnam par bcad pas byin gyis brlabs pa rnams su 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, in the eleventh month, there are the thirty blessings with bindus, and in the twelfth month, the blessings with divisions.

original: de nas zla ba'i khams khu ba'i khams kyi rtsa dang rkang dang rus pa rnams skyed pa yongs su chad de shes rab kyi lo bcu gnyis dang thabs kyi lo bcu drug la nyi ma rdul 'phel bar byed do //
analyzed: de nas zla ba'i khams khu ba'i khams kyi rtsa dang rkang dang rus pa rnams skyed pa yongs su chad de shes rab kyi lo bcu gnyis dang thabs kyi lo bcu drug la nyi ma rdul 'phel bar byed do //
translated: Then, the lunar element, the channel of the semen element, and the bones are produced. The wisdom of twelve years and the method of sixteen years increase the sun of the increase of the menses.üîΩ

original: de nas ye shes @276a * //
analyzed: de nas ye shes @276a * //
translated: Then the lunar element, the semen, having completed the generation of the channels, bones, and marrow, increases the solar element, the ovum, for twelve years of wisdom and sixteen years of method.

original: kyi khams smin te /
analyzed: kyi khams smin te /
translated: Then the element of gnosis ripens.

original: shes rab kyi rdul smin zhing thabs kyi khu ba smin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi rdul smin zhing thabs kyi khu ba smin no //
translated: The ovum of wisdom ripens and the semen of method ripens.

original: de nas snga ma bzhin du shes rab kyi gzhan lo bcu gnyis dang thabs kyi gzhan lo bcu drug tu sa'i khams smin no //
analyzed: de nas snga ma bzhin du shes rab kyi gzhan lo bcu gnyis dang thabs kyi gzhan lo bcu drug tu sa'i khams smin no //
translated: Then, as before, the earth element ripens for another twelve years of wisdom and sixteen years of method.

original: mtshams 'di nas snying stobs kyi chad bu mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshams 'di nas snying stobs kyi chad bu mar 'gyur ro //
translated: From this point on, the portion of sattva decreases.

original: slar yang shes rab kyi gzhan lo bco brgyad du chu'i khams smin te /
analyzed: slar yang shes rab kyi gzhan lo bco brgyad du chu'i khams smin te /
translated: Again, the water element ripens for another eighteen years of wisdom.

original: thabs kyi phyed dang bcas pa'i nyin zhag nyi shu rtsa gnyis dang / zla ba gcig lhag pa'i lo bcu drug tu snga ma bzhin du chu'i khams smin no //
analyzed: thabs kyi phyed dang bcas pa'i nyin zhag nyi shu rtsa gnyis dang / zla ba gcig lhag pa'i lo bcu drug tu snga ma bzhin du chu'i khams smin no //
translated: The water element ripens for sixteen years, with twenty-two days and one month added, as before.

original: shes rab kyi me smin pa ni snga ma bzhin te thabs kyi yang snga ma bzhin no //üîΩde bzhin du rlung gi khams smin pa dang nam mkha'i khams smin pa ste snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i dbye bas lo dgu bcu rtsa drug dang phyed dang bcas pa'i zla ba bcus khams thams cad smin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi me smin pa ni snga ma bzhin te thabs kyi yang snga ma bzhin no // de bzhin du rlung gi khams smin pa dang nam mkha'i khams smin pa ste snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i dbye bas lo dgu bcu rtsa drug dang phyed dang bcas pa'i zla ba bcus khams thams cad smin no //
translated: The ripening of the fire element is as before, and the method is also as before.üîΩSimilarly, the ripening of the wind element and the ripening of the space element are the divisions of sattva, rajas, and tamas.

original: de nas dbu ma'i rtsa lo dang phyogs dang nyin zhag gi tshad gsal byed sum cu'i  tshad de nyin zhag tshogs lnga bcu rtsa lnga lhag pa'i brgya phrag bcu gcig gis dus rab tu rgyu ste za bar byed do //
analyzed: de nas dbu ma'i rtsa lo dang phyogs dang nyin zhag gi tshad gsal byed sum cu'i  tshad de nyin zhag tshogs lnga bcu rtsa lnga lhag pa'i brgya phrag bcu gcig gis dus rab tu rgyu ste za bar byed do //
translated: Then, the madhyama channel has the measure of years, directions, and days, the measure of the thirty vowels. In the collection of days, there are fifty-five, plus eleven hundred. The time moves well, that is, it is consumed.

original: ka sogs sde rnams dbyangs dang bcas pa sngar brjod pa dag kyang yon tan gyis bsgyur ba nyin zhag stong brgyad cur gyur pa dang gang yang phyogs gsum dag gi dbyangs thung ngu dang ring po dang shin tu ring po bzhi bcu rtsa lnga dang /
analyzed: ka sogs sde rnams dbyangs dang bcas pa sngar brjod pa dag kyang yon tan gyis bsgyur ba nyin zhag stong brgyad cur gyur pa dang gang yang phyogs gsum dag gi dbyangs thung ngu dang ring po dang shin tu ring po bzhi bcu rtsa lnga dang /
translated: The vowels of the three directions, short, long, and very long, are forty-five.

original: nges par sum cu'i gsal byed de dag rnams la rnam gsum bgrod pa'i dbang gis zhes pa g-yon dang g-yas dang dbu ma'i bgrod pa'i dbang gis 'chi ba rgyu'o //
analyzed: nges par sum cu'i gsal byed de dag rnams la rnam gsum bgrod pa'i dbang gis zhes pa g-yon dang g-yas dang dbu ma'i bgrod pa'i dbang gis 'chi ba rgyu'o //
translated: The thirty consonants are definitely the cause of death by the power of the three movements, that is, by the power of the movements of the left, right, and middleüîΩnƒÅdƒ´s.

original: de bzhin du bkra shis la sogs pa gza' lnga'i rkang pa sum cu rtsa bzhi lhag pa'i brgya phrag bcu gcig sngar brjod pa rnams dang nyi ma ri bong can gyi rkang pa  ro dang dus dang ri bong can te rkang pa bcu gcig gi bdag nyid
analyzed: de bzhin du bkra shis la sogs pa gza' lnga'i rkang pa sum cu rtsa bzhi lhag pa'i brgya phrag bcu gcig sngar brjod pa rnams dang nyi ma ri bong can gyi rkang pa  ro dang dus dang ri bong can te rkang pa bcu gcig gi bdag nyid
translated: In the same way, the thirty-four feet of the five planets, such as B·πõhaspati, and the previously mentioned eleven hundred and one feet of the sun and the moon, which are the nature of the eleven feet of RƒÅhu,

original: dang / sgra gcan mjug rings rkang pa ste sgra gcan gyi rkang pa ni phyed dang bcas pa'i bdun gyi bdag nyid de zla ba yongs su bcad pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: dang / sgra gcan mjug rings rkang pa ste sgra gcan gyi rkang pa ni phyed dang bcas pa'i bdun gyi bdag nyid de zla ba yongs su bcad pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: And the foot of RƒÅhu, the long tail, is the foot of RƒÅhu, which is seven and a half, the nature of the complete moon.

original: mjug rengs 'char ba'i rkang pa ni nyin zhag so sor chu tshod gnyis kyi bdag nyid de rkang pa chu tshod kyi bdag nyid 'di dag ni lo gsum dang phyogs gsum dang gsal byed sum cu'i nyin zhag gi grangs te 'di dag nyid la 'chi brgyu'o //
analyzed: mjug rengs 'char ba'i rkang pa ni nyin zhag so sor chu tshod gnyis kyi bdag nyid de rkang pa chu tshod kyi bdag nyid 'di dag ni lo gsum dang phyogs gsum dang gsal byed sum cu'i nyin zhag gi grangs te 'di dag nyid la 'chi brgyu'o //
translated: The foot of the rising of the long tail is the nature of two hours each day. These feet, which are the nature of hours, are the number of days of three years, three half-months, and thirty vowels, and in them the death-time is calculated.

original: de bzhin du sum cu rtsa gnyis lo dang phyogs kyang yon tan gyis bsgyur ba zla ba nyi ma me yis phye ba'i zhes pa ni snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pas phye ba ste lo dgu @276b bcu rtsa drug dang gzhan phyed dang bcas pa'i zla ba
analyzed: de bzhin du sum cu rtsa gnyis lo dang phyogs kyang yon tan gyis bsgyur ba zla ba nyi ma me yis phye ba'i zhes pa ni snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pas phye ba ste lo dgu @276b bcu rtsa drug dang gzhan phyed dang bcas pa'i zla ba
translated: Similarly, thirty-two years and half-months are the directions, divided by the qualities of sattva, rajas, and tamas, that is, divided by the moon, sun, and fire.

original: bcu'i phyogs rnams so //
analyzed: bcu'i phyogs rnams so //
translated: The half-months are the directions of the nine and sixty years and the ten half-months.

original: g-yon dang g-yas kyi rtsa'i phyogs lo brgya'i phyogs rnams kyi nang nas lo gsum gyi ni phyogs rnams dag ste bdun cu rtsa gnyis dang / ri bong can gyi yon tan de phyogs gsum dang dus kyi me yi phyogs gnyis dag ste /
analyzed: g-yon dang g-yas kyi rtsa'i phyogs lo brgya'i phyogs rnams kyi nang nas lo gsum gyi ni phyogs rnams dag ste bdun cu rtsa gnyis dang / ri bong can gyi yon tan de phyogs gsum dang dus kyi me yi phyogs gnyis dag ste /
translated: From the directions of the three qualities of the moon and the two directions of the fire of time,

original: de ltar phyogs bdun cu rtsa bdun lo brgya las ni ste lo brgya'i phyogs kyi phung po brgya phrag nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i grangs las dman par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar phyogs bdun cu rtsa bdun lo brgya las ni ste lo brgya'i phyogs kyi phung po brgya phrag nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i grangs las dman par gyur pa'o //
translated: thus, in seventy-seven directions, there are twenty-four hundred groups of one hundred directions less than one hundred years.

original: lhag ma'i phyogs ni nyi zla dag gi ste g-yas dang g-yon gyi'o //
analyzed: lhag ma'i phyogs ni nyi zla dag gi ste g-yas dang g-yon gyi'o //
translated: The remaining directions are of the sun and moon, right and left.

original: 'jig rten mig dang me mig grags zhes pa nyi shu rtsa gsum lhag pa'i brgya phrag nyi shu rtsa gsum mo //
analyzed: 'jig rten mig dang me mig grags zhes pa nyi shu rtsa gsum lhag pa'i brgya phrag nyi shu rtsa gsum mo //
translated: The world eye and fire eye are known as twenty-three plus one hundred.

original: de bzhin du nyin mtshan dus rnams gtso bo dag gis dman pa mtha' dad ste lo brgya'i stong phrag sum cu rtsa drug go //
analyzed: de bzhin du nyin mtshan dus rnams gtso bo dag gis dman pa mtha' dad ste lo brgya'i stong phrag sum cu rtsa drug go //
translated: Thus, in the directions of the principal days and nights, there are thirty-six thousand less than one hundred years.

original: gtso bos dman pa ni lo gsum dang phyogs gsum dang gsal byed kyi zla bas dman pa ste g-yon dang g-yas la 'chi bas zos pa'o //
analyzed: gtso bos dman pa ni lo gsum dang phyogs gsum dang gsal byed kyi zla bas dman pa ste g-yon dang g-yas la 'chi bas zos pa'o //
translated: The inferior one is the one that is inferior by three years, three fortnights, and the vowels. It is devoured by death on the left and the right.

original: gsal byed la sogs sde pa dbyangs rnams dag ni nyi ma zla ba'i bgrod pa'i dbang gis 'chi bas zos te /
analyzed: gsal byed la sogs sde pa dbyangs rnams dag ni nyi ma zla ba'i bgrod pa'i dbang gis 'chi bas zos te /
translated: The vowels, which are the class of the vowels, etc., are devoured by death by the power of the movement of the sun and moon.

original: 'chi ltas nas brtsams nas dbu ma'i dus su zos so //
analyzed: 'chi ltas nas brtsams nas dbu ma'i dus su zos so //
translated: It is devoured in the middle at the time of the asterism of death.

original: de bzhin du phyed bcas 'khor lo'i chu tshod phyed bcas 'khor lo ni khyim bco brgyad kyi grangs te sum cu rtsa lnga lhag pa'i brgyas bsgyur ba sum cu lhag pa'i brgya phrag nyi shu rtsa bzhi ni chu tshod kyi grangs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyed bcas 'khor lo'i chu tshod phyed bcas 'khor lo ni khyim bco brgyad kyi grangs te sum cu rtsa lnga lhag pa'i brgyas bsgyur ba sum cu lhag pa'i brgya phrag nyi shu rtsa bzhi ni chu tshod kyi grangs so //
translated: In the same way, the wheel of half-hours with half-hours is the number of the eighteen houses, multiplied by 350, 2400 times, which is the number of half-hours.

original: ri bong can gyi rkang pa ni rim pa dang rim pa ma yin pa'i dbye bas 'byung dang 'byung ba mda' dang rig byed la sogs pa brgya'i grangs te /
analyzed: ri bong can gyi rkang pa ni rim pa dang rim pa ma yin pa'i dbye bas 'byung dang 'byung ba mda' dang rig byed la sogs pa brgya'i grangs te /
translated: The foot of the rabbit is the number of the elements, elements, arrows, Vedas, etc., by the division of regular and irregular.

original: de dag dang bral ba ni ri bong can gyi rkang pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de dag dang bral ba ni ri bong can gyi rkang pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Free from that is free from the foot of the rabbit.

original: gza'i chu tshod ni bdun te des dman pa mtha' dag ni nyi shu rtsa gsum lhag pa'i brgya phrag nyi shu rtsa gsum gyi grangs so //
analyzed: gza'i chu tshod ni bdun te des dman pa mtha' dag ni nyi shu rtsa gsum lhag pa'i brgya phrag nyi shu rtsa gsum gyi grangs so //
translated: The [planetary] hours are seven, and the rest are the number of twenty-three hundred and twenty-three.

original: shes rab thabs kyi rab tu dbye ba dag gis te sdud pa dang skyed pa'i dbye bas nyin mtshan dus kyis de dag rnams kyang 'chi ba bros so //
analyzed: shes rab thabs kyi rab tu dbye ba dag gis te sdud pa dang skyed pa'i dbye bas nyin mtshan dus kyis de dag rnams kyang 'chi ba bros so //
translated: By the divisions of wisdom and means, that is, by the divisions of gathering and generation, those [planetary hours] are the death-fleeing [hours] of the day and night.

original: de ltar sde pa dbyangs bcas dbyangs kyi tshogs dang bcas pa gsal byed rnams nyid dag dang rkang pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar sde pa dbyangs bcas dbyangs kyi tshogs dang bcas pa gsal byed rnams nyid dag dang rkang pa ni /
translated: Thus, the classes, with their tones and their tone-sets, are the very consonants. The feet are

original: dman dang bar ma dus 'chi zla ba nyi ma'i 'chi ba dang ni gsal byed lhag pa'i lha la'i zhes pa ni dman pa zla ba'i 'chi ltas kyi 'chi ba dang / bar ma nyi ma'i 'chi ltas kyi 'chi ba dang / gsal byed lhag pa'i lha dbu ma'i dus su 'chi ba'i 'chi ba la ste sngar brjod pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: dman dang bar ma dus 'chi zla ba nyi ma'i 'chi ba dang ni gsal byed lhag pa'i lha la'i zhes pa ni dman pa zla ba'i 'chi ltas kyi 'chi ba dang / bar ma nyi ma'i 'chi ltas kyi 'chi ba dang / gsal byed lhag pa'i lha dbu ma'i dus su 'chi ba'i 'chi ba la ste sngar brjod pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: the death of the inferior, the death of the middling, the death of the sun and moon, and the death of the excess consonants. The death of the inferior is the death-omen of the moon, the death of the middling is the death-omen of the sun, and the death of the excess consonants is the death at the time of the central deity. This is the previously stated rule.

original: de nas sum cu gnyis dang nyin zhag gcig kyang zhes pa nyin zhag sum cu rtsa @277a * //
analyzed: de nas sum cu gnyis dang nyin zhag gcig kyang zhes pa nyin zhag sum cu rtsa @277a * //
translated: means thirty-three day and night.

original: gsum mo // ri bong can bcas nyi ma'i bgrod la ste g-yon pa'i bgrod pa dang bcas pa'i g-yas pa'i bgrod pa las rtsa ni gcod pa 'di thun mong ba'o //
analyzed: gsum mo // ri bong can bcas nyi ma'i bgrod la ste g-yon pa'i bgrod pa dang bcas pa'i g-yas pa'i bgrod pa las rtsa ni gcod pa 'di thun mong ba'o //
translated: The cutting of the channel is common, from the movement of the sun together with the moon, that is, from the movement of the right together with the movement of the left.üîΩIn the case of timely death, again, by thirty nights and three,

original: dus kyi 'chi ba la ni slar yang ste sum cu mtshan mo gsum gyis zhes pa nyin zhag sum cu rtsa gsum gyis rdo rje dang bcas te lus dang ngag dang sems dang bcas pa'i phung po khams dang dbang po la sogs 'dor ro //
analyzed: dus kyi 'chi ba la ni slar yang ste sum cu mtshan mo gsum gyis zhes pa nyin zhag sum cu rtsa gsum gyis rdo rje dang bcas te lus dang ngag dang sems dang bcas pa'i phung po khams dang dbang po la sogs 'dor ro //
translated: means by thirty-three day and night, together with the vajra, the body, speech, and mind, the aggregates, elements, faculties, and so on, are cast off.

original: de nas dor nas zla ba nyi ma'i rtsa la la n'a dang ra sa n'a dag dang dung can ma aa ba dh'u t'ir srog gi rlung dag nyin gcig rab 'jug ste sa dang chu dang bsreg za rlung dang nam mkha'i khams ni rnam par chad pa jiüîΩsrid nyid du'o //
analyzed: de nas dor nas zla ba nyi ma'i rtsa la la n'a dang ra sa n'a dag dang dung can ma aa ba dh'u t'ir srog gi rlung dag nyin gcig rab 'jug ste sa dang chu dang bsreg za rlung dang nam mkha'i khams ni rnam par chad pa jiüîΩsrid nyid du'o //
translated: Then, having cast off, in the channels of the moon and sun, lalanƒÅ and rasanƒÅ, and in the conch shell, avadh≈´tƒ´, the vital winds enter for one day, and the elements of earth, water, fire, wind, and space are cut off just as they are.

original: 'dir 'chi ba'i nyin zhag la dbu mar srog rab tu zhugs te dus kyi rlung gis dman par gyur pa na lte bar sa'i khams yon tan lnga'i rang bzhin 'dor te de nas sa'i khams rnam par chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir 'chi ba'i nyin zhag la dbu mar srog rab tu zhugs te dus kyi rlung gis dman par gyur pa na lte bar sa'i khams yon tan lnga'i rang bzhin 'dor te de nas sa'i khams rnam par chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, on the day of death, when the life-force has entered the central channel and the winds of time have become weak, the earth element, which has the nature of five qualities, is abandoned at the navel. Then the earth element is cut off.

original: snying gar chu'i khams yon tan bzhi'i rang bzhin 'dor te chu'i khams rnam par chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snying gar chu'i khams yon tan bzhi'i rang bzhin 'dor te chu'i khams rnam par chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: At the heart, the water element, which has the nature of four qualities, is abandoned, and then the water element is cut off.

original: mgrin par me'i khams yon tan gsum gyi rang bzhin 'dor te de nas ma'i khams rnam par chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mgrin par me'i khams yon tan gsum gyi rang bzhin 'dor te de nas ma'i khams rnam par chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: At the throat, the fire element, which has the nature of three qualities, is abandoned, and then the fire element is cut off.

original: dpral bar rlung gi khams yon tan gnyis kyi rang bzhin 'dor te de nas rlung gi khams rnam par chad pas 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dpral bar rlung gi khams yon tan gnyis kyi rang bzhin 'dor te de nas rlung gi khams rnam par chad pas 'gyur ro //
translated: At the forehead, the wind element, which has the nature of two qualities, is abandoned, and then the wind element is cut off.

original: gtsug tor du nam mkha'i khams yon tan gcig gi rang bzhin 'dor te de nas stong pa'i khams rnam par 'chad do zhes pa ni steng du srog gi khams yongs su 'dor pa'o //
analyzed: gtsug tor du nam mkha'i khams yon tan gcig gi rang bzhin 'dor te de nas stong pa'i khams rnam par 'chad do zhes pa ni steng du srog gi khams yongs su 'dor pa'o //
translated: At the crown, the space element, which has the nature of one quality, is abandoned, and then the space element is cut off. This is the complete abandonment of the life-force above.

original: 'og tu lte bar lus kyi thig le'i chos thur sel 'dor ro //
analyzed: 'og tu lte bar lus kyi thig le'i chos thur sel 'dor ro //
translated: Below, at the navel, the body bindu's element, the downward-clearing wind, is released.

original: de nas sad pa'i gnas skabs zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas sad pa'i gnas skabs zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then the waking state is severed.

original: gsang bar ngag gi thig le'i chos 'dor te /
analyzed: gsang bar ngag gi thig le'i chos 'dor te /
translated: In the secret place, the speech bindu's element is released.

original: de nas rmi lam gyi gnas skabs chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas rmi lam gyi gnas skabs chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then the dream state is severed.

original: nor bur sems kyi thig le'i chos 'dor te de nas shin tu gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nor bur sems kyi thig le'i chos 'dor te de nas shin tu gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the jewel, the mind bindu's element is released. Then the state of deep sleep is severed.

original: de bzhin du steng du yang rdul gyi khams kyi thig le rnams srog gis 'dor te /
analyzed: de bzhin du steng du yang rdul gyi khams kyi thig le rnams srog gis 'dor te /
translated: Likewise, above, the bindus of the element of semen are released by the life-force wind.

original: de nas lus dang ngag dang sems ni rnam par chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas lus dang ngag dang sems ni rnam par chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then the body, speech, and mind are severed.

original: 'pho ba'i dus su drug pa ye shes kyi khams 'dor ro //
analyzed: 'pho ba'i dus su drug pa ye shes kyi khams 'dor ro //
translated: At the time of transference, the sixth element, gnosis, is released.

original: yan lag thams cad la khu ba 'og tu 'dor zhing rdul steng du 'dor te bzhi pa'i gnas skabs rnam par chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yan lag thams cad la khu ba 'og tu 'dor zhing rdul steng du 'dor te bzhi pa'i gnas skabs rnam par chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhicitta is released below in all the limbs, and the red element is released above. Then the fourth state is severed.

original: de ltar mngal nas skyes pa rnams 'chi ba'i dus des pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar mngal nas skyes pa rnams 'chi ba'i dus des pa'o //
translated: That is the way of dying for those born from a womb.

original: bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i 'grel bshad rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od las 'jig rten kun rdzob kyi skye ba dang 'gag pa'i rgyur gyur pa skad cig gi mtshan nyid dus kyi
analyzed: bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i 'grel bshad rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od las 'jig rten kun rdzob kyi skye ba dang 'gag pa'i rgyur gyur pa skad cig gi mtshan nyid dus kyi
translated: In the Stainless Light, a commentary on the root tantra of the Condensed Tantra of the Wheel of Time, a king of tantras, it is said that the characteristics of the instant are the cause of the arising and cessation of the relative world.

original: 'khor lo nges pa'i mdor bsdus chen po ste lnga pa'o /
analyzed: 'khor lo nges pa'i mdor bsdus chen po ste lnga pa'o /
translated: The fifth is the great summary of the definitive tantra of the wheel of time, the characteristic of the instant that is the cause of the birth and cessation of the relative world, from the Stainless Light, a commentary on the king of summarized tantras, the wheel of time, that follows the root tantra in twelve thousand chapters.
